campaign.story:
The Tome of Debasement
Behold the Inglorious Bottom Feeder, the Lord of Twisted Faces, the Sovereign of the Forgotten, Herlezzect the Debased God!
This DCC RPG compatible zine details the followers of Herlezzect, the Debased God, in the same format as those in the DCC Annual Vol. 1 (from Goodman Games). The zine covers the unique traits, disapproval results, and canticles for evil cultists who pledge themselves to the debased one. The bulk of the zine is taken up by a collection of spells geared for use by the evil clerics in your games, with evocative titles like: Deceiving Visage, Putrescent Bog, Rotting Stench, Halo of Flies, Lash, Twisted Form, Radiant Corruption, and Uncontrollable Urge.  You're probably thinking those would make a great tracklisting for a metal album, and you'd probably be right.
This gaming zine is designed to make your evil priests on your tabletop more sinister and terrifying to face, channeling otherworldly horror and cinematic imagery.
Worm Tunnel is a 5th level canticle available to followers of Herlezzect
Putrescent Bog is one of the first level cleric spells
Those are just a couple of examples of the treacherous magics contained within!
PG-13?
This is a zine full of evil priest spells. As a young gamer who loved AD&D and bands like Mercyful Fate with equal measure, I don't see any content here that I couldn't see a young me being stoked on... But that was the 80's, and this is now. There's lots of maggots, grossness, and some self-mutilation. You know, evil priest stuff. This book revels in light-hearted darkness, but darkness none-the-less, so be warned. 
Writing and Art Credits:
The writing was done by myself, Nick Baran. This time Jamie Jordan and Mike Tommyrot will be handling all of the art. Find Jamie Jordan @noirfade and Mike Tommyrot @miketommyrot on Instagram.
 Zine Stats: 
This zine is slated to be 36 pages, saddle stitched. The interior will be black and white on 60# text and the cover will be black on colored 65# cover stock. This zine will be printed at DigiCopy, here in Milwaukee, WI.
The Goal:
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise the funds to print 100 copies of this 36 page zine. Additional money will fund additional copies, stickers, and art for future projects.
Combo Deals:
The Tome of Debasement will be our third zine and fourth DCC RPG compatible release. We know that some completists are going to want ALL of our content, particularly in light of the fact that all four releases revolve around our grimdark, horror-tinged take on DCC RPG. With that in mind, here are three combo deals meant to give you everything that you want.
Combo 1 - Tome and Terror: The Tome of Debasement and Wide-eyed Terror Zines
Did you miss out on the Wide-eyed Terror Zine Kickstarter earlier this month? Here's another chance to get in on the 1st printing. At this Backer Level you will receive print and PDF copies of both The Tome of Debasement and Wide-eyed Terror zines.
Combo 2 - Tome, Terror, and Rabid Dogs: The Tome of Debasement, Wide-eyed Terror, and Rabid Dogs Zines
We get it, you love zines as much as we do. At this Backer Level you want to add a copy of the 2nd printing of Rabid Dogs Zine, our RPG zine debut from last year. This new 2nd printing fixes some typos, upgrades the only encounter map, and adds 4 more pages of content in the form of the Icon Bearer character class. All told, you will receive all 3 of our zines: The Tome of Debasement, Wide-eyed Terror, and Rabid Dogs zines in print and PDF formats. You will notice a substantial increase in shipping as we upgrade to a hard mailer.
Combo 3 - Full Corruption: The Tome of Debasement, Wide-eyed Terror, Rabid Dogs Zines, and The Precipice of Corruption Adventure Module
Are you a completist? Do you want to use the classes in Rabid Dogs Zine, while driving off the horrors from Wide-eyed Terror? Do you want the evil priest in The Precipice of Corruption to have tailor made spells from The Tome of Debasement? You will want all of this content in one shot. You will receive all 4 of our DCC RPG compatible releases: The Tome of Debasement, Wide-eyed Terror, and Rabid Dogs zines, along with our first adventure module, The Precipice of Corruption in print and PDF formats. You will notice a substantial increase in shipping as we upgrade to a hard mailer.

Free RPG2 Cover

Halflings and the Hive is a system agnostic adventure workbook for your favorite roleplaying game. This edition is revised and expanded from the previous Ghengis Con and Exalted Funeral's Free RPG 2 versions. The last version had 22 pages, this one will have 26 if no stretch goals are met.
The existing text has already been edited by Jarrett Crader  of the Moonrat Conspiracy (Ultra Violet Grasslands, Mothership stuff, Fever Swamp) and is getting some additional material based on things we've figured out from running and being players in it. We have also hit up Christian Kessler, also of the Moonrat Conspiracy (Silent Titans) to consult upon improving the layout.
It will be black and white photo copied digest sized. The card-stock cover will be removable with a double spread map on the inside spread. There will also be a loose card-stock sheet with frequently used tables that may serve as a bookmark. The goal of this zine is to be used during play to not only provide the adventure, but to also keep record of what has happened.
Map of the Village Cerwin
Trans-dimensional bees have set up a hive in the village of Cerwin. The halflings have all fallen on hard times. Blood Cults and Bee Cults vie for influence. People are getting high on some funky honey. 
The zine is designed as a workbook to be written in during play with tables to figure out what gripes, grudges and goals motivate each NPC. 

NPC Worksheet
NPC Generator Table

As the players go about the village they will interact with several factions. As members of a faction are killed, by the players or by other NPCs, or the inn burning down, whatever, tracks are filled up which indicate how the faction responds.

Sample Faction Page.
Stu Horvath from Vintage RPG  said,
 "The focus here is on setting up the faction dominos, then letting the players come in and knock them all down. This sort of emergent story is always a good time, particularly if your group is like mine and never does what you expect (and tends to make a mess of solvable situations). There are some fun tools for tracking the local population and their relationships, too, which is always a draw for me.
The art is a standout, too: a nice mix of cartoonish and yucky that kind of remind me of Garbage Pail Kids or Big Daddy Roth."
The new stuff definitely getting added since the last version:
A list of character names grouped by faction
A table for what's going on in town when the party shows up or if there is a lull in the action
New art
Crazy bees.

Followers of the Holy Hive
We'll be doing shirts again, silkscreen printed in Cleveland.
Baseball Three quarter length sleeve t-shirt.
If you're really into Halflings and the Hive, you can also pick up a double sided 11x17 inch Risograph poster map, all the maps and some cool extra art. Along with this you will get a collection of accessories to help run the module. Firstly, 12 NPC folios, all of the random table entries on chits and a pot of Holy Honey Rubber Cement to affix the Gripes Grudges and Goals to the NPC folio. Additionally the deluxe version will come with cardstock miniatures of all of the creatures, cultists, humans and halflings of Cerwin, along with a few bears (these will come with all copies of the zine if the stretch goal is unlocked). We will also have  MDF faction death tracks and plastic tombstone markers. Lastly, we are creating a soundtrack that will help convey the misery and desperation and ceaseless buzzing of the bees. 
We are also having one inch pinback buttons made.
The synths and pedals that will make the Drone Buzz drone
A hobbi--- er, halfling, chilling
Shipping charges are collected through Kickstarter along with the pledge, so no surprises. 
Everything will be shipped by USPS with tracking, with guaranteed delivery.
International shipping is admittedly crazy expensive, but it will have tracking. If you live outside of the United States and like to live on the razor's edge, we could ship you the zine only without tracking as an oversize letter. In this case we'd' only guarantee that we have sent it, we cannot guarantee receipt. This method will only cost you $6, and works only for the basic print pledge, contact us to make this arrangement. Just to reiterate, this will save you a few dollars but the risk of shipping without tracking in a regular envelope is on you.
All physical rewards will be going out at the same time in August, PDFs will go out once the new version is finalized (June in all likelihood, but not promising until August).
Todd Jakubisin is a Cleveland Ohio based artist having illustrated board games such as Pests! and Flip-n-Finds Diner, and currently designs puzzles for Akron Ohio’s alt news magazine; The Devil Strip. In the summer of 2020 he established Timepiece Press to create and house comics for all ages and unique greeting cards. This is his 4th kickstarter he is involved with.
Beckett Warren runs Weird Realms, made his first zine more than 20 years ago (both issues even made the Maximum Rock n Roll zine top ten the month they were submitted for review!), has had writings published in organs of varying respectability, and has been writing songs for largely ignorable bands, most recently Cracked Cup.

campaign.story:
From the mind of Daniel J. Bishop comes a dangerous adventure that pits players against monsters, nature, and even time itself.
You spy a semi-ruined inn on the road ahead, promising shelter from the dark woods that close in around you. But the inn is not deserted. Haunted by phantoms of the past, creatures of the present, and a malignant entity with dark designs for the future, you slip between all three timelines. As these timelines merge and horrors from the past slip into the present, you find yourself confronted by a dark and wild future that you may not be able to avoid. Worse, a future you may have helped to create!
example cover by Bartek Kucharski
What is The Inn in the Forest?
The Inn in the Forest is a DCC RPG long-format, time-traveling, horror adventure by Daniel J. Bishop heavily influenced by the darker side of the Brothers Grimm, the moody ghost tales of M.R. James and William Hope Hodgson, and the horror stories of Robert E. Howard.
Providing multiple nights of eerie entertainment as a stand-alone adventure or as a persistent part of a larger campaign, The Inn in the Forest is perfect for any DCC or OSR setting of any time period, including Weird Frontiers, Mutant Crawl Classics (MCC RPG), Shudder Mountains, Crawlthulu, OSRIC, and Labyrinth Lord.
As a player, you take the part of an unwitting traveler seeking shelter for the night. Whether drawn this direction to search for the lost magic of Zauberer the Hexmaster or following up on rumors of the innkeeper’s dark practices, what you encounter is so much worse. Sometimes making it to dawn means success, other times it may just mean trading your companions’ souls to gain the power the Waldgeist grants!
As a Judge, you will be running a unique adventure, where time is not static. Phantom shifts allow you to tell the story of the inn during its heyday as well its current state. As the PCs interact with the haunting of the inn’s past, the very real threats of its present seek to destroy them. Rules on phantom shifts, as well as new monsters, items, artifacts, and rituals, are included to bring new dimensions of gameplay to your ttrpg.
Author Interview with Daniel J. Bishop
PLAY

Weird Frontiers and MCC Integration
PLAY

The Art
PLAY

What’s inside the zine?
The Inn in the Forest (Hardcover, Softcover, PDF): an 8.5”x5.5”, 40-64 page, black and white, folded and stapled zine with a cardstock cover or in a signed, hardcover version for collectors. All backers at the Squire level or higher receive a PDF of The Inn in the Forest, a PDF of the original preview edition, and their name in the backer credits. Backers can also choose rewards that include softcover and limited edition hardcover version of the zine. Retailers also have the option to order a pack of 5 or 10 zines. Backers below the Squire level still receive a PDF of the original preview edition.

Content includes:
 “The Inn in the Forest” long-form adventure for levels 1-2: a completely revised, multi-session horror adventure written by Daniel J. Bishop where the PCs retreat to the inn only to face new dangers in the here and now, the past, and a potential future where the inn’s malignant forces have already spread throughout the Forest...and beyond!
 Two adventures in one! Guidance on using the inn in its heyday for a Sweeney Todd-like challenge (or even removing the horrors for use as a great launching point for, or rest stop between, other adventures in a persistent campaign).
 The Forest: the story and motivations of a Bavarian forest fighting back against the onslaught of human “progress.”
 Waldgeist as Patron: the spirit of the forest, worshiped in ancient times, that hates humanity and seeks to overthrow civilization, with the ability to grant immortality upon its worshipers. Complete with invoke patron results, spellburn, patron taint, and spells.
 Wilderness Encounters: tables on day and night encounters for Bavarian forests.
 Phantom Shifts: new rules on being ripped from your current timeline to the past, future, or even parallel worlds.
 New Rituals: bring The Forest to life in your own campaign with Will of the Forest and Waldgeist’s Wail.
 New Monsters: new versions of the Erddämonen, Ebersache, Sau, and Schallgeber, as well as other monsters and creatures from all three timelines.
 New Items: corpse candles, strange milks, and other new items can be found in and around the Inn.
 New Artifacts: Waldgeist’s Tainted Root and the Lost Runestaff of Zauberer the Hexmaster.

What is Dungeon Crawl Classics?
Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game (DCC RPG) is a tabletop role playing game published by Goodman Games. DCC uses modern mechanics to allow players to experience sword and sorcery adventures in line with the Appendix N books that inspired Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson to create Dungeons & Dragons. You can download the free quick start rules at Goodman Games > Shop Now > Free DCC RPG Quick Start Rules. It includes rules up to level 2 so includes everything you need to play The Inn in the Forest.
What is the Plan?
1) Get funded. Once the Kickstarter ends, we wait for funds to transfer.  After that, all backers receive a PDF of the original preview edition that started it all.
2) Commission art. Commission the final pieces of art and wrap up the initial editing.
3) Playtest and fix typos. Backers at the Squire level and higher receive an early version of the zine in PDF format for playtesting and typo catching. We want everyone to get the best final product possible.
4) Finalize content. We implement final art and revisions, then complete softcover, hardcover, and PDF layout. We also test and finalize all VTT + Convention Play Pack assets.
5) Get things printed. We then order softcover and hardcover test prints and, once everything looks perfect, order the full print runs.
6) Ship the zines, share the PDFs, and share the VTT + Convention Play Pack. We securely package your softcover and hardcover zines and ship those out, as well as release the final zine PDFs and VTT + Convention Play Pack assets. All backers receive the final version of their backer rewards.
7) Start on the next zine. We already have new artists and content lined up for the next few zines, so will be sharing more about those once The Inn in the Forest is done.
About the Creators
Daniel J. Bishop (Author): Daniel started playing Dungeons & Dragons on Christmas Day 1979 with the Holmes Blue Box set and immediately fell in love. Encountering the Dungeon Crawl Classics rules brought back the kind of joy and energy that those early games had. His first published work for DCC was Bone Hoard of the Dancing Horror in 2012 and he's never looked back. Since then, Daniel has had over 40 adventures published for DCC, including Goodman Games’ The Imperishable Sorceress, The Dread God Al-Khazadar, Through the Dragonwall, and DCC Lankmar's The Fence's Fortuitous Folly. He has also done official conversions of D&D 3E, D&D 4E, and XCrawl! materials for Goodman Games, but is perhaps best known as the author of The Arwich Grinder. Daniel's philosophy is that the decisions the players make should always matter. If there are consequences that live on long after the adventure is done, that's so much better! He lives in Toronto, Canada, where the maple syrup is plentiful and the gaming is fine.
Daniel J. Bishop: then, now, and some of his many DCC contribution as an author
Shyloh Wideman (Project Manager, Editor, Layout): To support his gaming and guitar playing habits, Shyloh is co-owner and Chief Creative Officer of a software and web development company that primarily works with government and non-profit organizations to provide better service and support to the public. Back in 1980, at age 8, Shyloh bought the AD&D Player’s Handbook, Dungeon Master’s Guide, and Monster Manual and had his parents worry about him ever since. Moving almost yearly, Shyloh never had a gaming group in his youth but played the occasional D&D and Call of Cthulhu game once he entered college. It wasn’t until 2007, when he reconnected with some old college friends, did he start gaming regularly. Shyloh fell into the DCC community accidentally in 2017 when he showed a map he drew to a friend, who then posted it to Google+, where Daniel picked it up and wrote his Thirteen Brides of Blood adventure based off it. This was published in the DCC zine, The Gongfarmer’s Almanac, later that year. Shyloh soon became deeply involved in the GFA as a cartographer, editor, and layout artist, then also as one of the two lead admins for the 2019 and 2020 publication years. With his focus on community outreach and engagement, he helped grow the GFA from 8 volumes and 350 pages to 16 volumes and 800 pages, culminating in the release of over 30 zines in print and PDF formats, as well as annual compilations in hardcover, softcover, and PDF formats in that 2-year span. He has also provided cartography, artwork, editing, and editable character sheets for other DCC RPG-compatible publications, including Weird Frontiers RPG (formerly Dark Trails RPG) and Bronx Beasts.
The Gongfarmer's Almanac: some of the individual zines and compliations Shyloh helped produce
Bartek Kucharski (Lead Artist): Bartek first played RPGs back in the late 1990s, primarily Warhammer 2nd edition (where 15 friends had to share one rulebook between them), but also some Werewolf, Vampire Masquerade, and Call of Cthulhu. Unfortunately that all ended after a year when all their Warhammer characters died in a massive battle with chaos forces, people moved away, and new characters weren’t near and dear to the heart. It actually took the pandemic and an RPG rabbit hole to bring Bartek back into gaming. Bored, jumping around YouTube to find a good DnD session, he saw a review of DCC, bought The Leech cover version of the core rulebook, and while waiting for it to ship from 2000km away (Bartek’s in Poland), discovered The Gongfarmer’s Almanac through a Spellburn podcast. He reached out to see if any art was needed for the 2020 release and was connected with Daniel Bishop, providing all the artwork for the original preview edition released in the GFA. Bartek has been drawing his whole life, tattooing professionally since 2009, and actively illustrating for the RPG industry since 2020, primarily providing cover art and interior illustrations for adventures and zines. After “tattooing the same thing over and over,” Bartek describes his game illustration work as a creative joy but also a creative challenge as, “I think there is no drug strong enough to induce ideas presented in DCC.” | Instagram

Risks and challenges
This is a relatively small Kickstarter project, with writing, artwork, and layout currently underway by a team of established DCC content contributors, including an author with over 40 published DCC adventures (including ones for Goodman Games), a project manager who has helped produce over 30 DCC zines in the last two years, and a great set of artists who have created hundreds of pieces already for DCC and other RPG products.

I will be using Mixam, known for their quality and consistency, for printing. I will fulfill all orders myself and will be sending zines out in a rigid, flat cardboard mailer.

With Covid-19 still around, shipping may take more time than normal and there is always the chance that someone may get sick. To address this:
- we have backups for editing, layout, and distribution, an alternate local printer, and more than enough artists to handle any artwork or cartography that may need to be reassigned
- we have added a month into the timeline to account for delays
- we are doing concurrent work, giving all contributors extra time to complete their tasks without it affecting the overall project timeline

Long-lasting design
Durable covers and high quality inking make a product that will physically last. High quality content that extends the DCC RPG core rules allows you to use these published materials long into the future in other adventures and your own persistent campaign setting.
Reusability and recyclability
Only the products needed for the project and sales will be printed, limiting waste in packaging and in product overages. The product itself is recyclable.
Sustainable materials
Printing is done on recycled paper using vegetable based inks. Packaging is recyclable.
Environmentally friendly factories
We work with print shops that use recycled paper and vegetable based inks, and also recycle waste products.
Sustainable Distribution
This product is made in the USA. We are also looking into international print-on-demand solutions for foreign markets to eliminate unnecessary overseas shipping, unnecessary customer costs, and delays in getting the zines through customs.

campaign.story:
THE DRAGONWILDS is a classic fantasy hex-crawl campaign setting presented as a pair of jam-packed zines lavishly illustrated by the talented DC Stow. Designed for Realms of Peril and compatible with OSR systems.
📗 THE DRAGONWILDS GAZETTEER is a complete reference guide containing a massive, fully-stocked hexcrawl adventure map with detailed regions, cities and towns, NPCs, factions, guilds, and more. 70+ pages, spot color, soft-touch, staple-bound zine.
📙 THE DRAGONWILDS COMPENDIUM is where all the evil, wretched, dark things hide. Here you'll find more than a dozen interactive and re-usable dungeons populated by terrible foes and vexing puzzles. Monster stats can also be found here, along with descriptions of all the wondrous magical items lucky adventurers might unearth. 70+ pages, spot color, soft-touch, staple-bound zine. 
Compendium Cover by DC Stow
⚔️ The Dragonwilds is designed to be an example West Marches hex-crawl setting that you could create using the processes described in Realms of Peril. If you haven't seen Realms of Peril yet, check it out here! 
⚔️ It will be easily usable with games like: Old-School Essentials, Knave, Maze Rats, The GLOG, Troika, Cairn, Rogueland, Dungeon World, World of Dungeons, Into the Odd, Five Torches Deep, and similar games.

Example monster stats. Easy use for OSR games.
Mini conversion guide: HP per HD, THAC0 per HD, Saves per HD, Armor 0 = No armor, Armor 1 = Leather, Armor 2 = Chain, Armor 3 = Plate. 
📗 Book #1 focuses on the overland map. Grab this one if you want a big, densely populated hex crawl that your group can spend dozens of sessions exploring. Use with book #2 for the full experience!
📗 Nearly 250 hexes with something interesting to find in each and every one. Encounters with wayward knights looking to joust? Yep. Sea caves infested with giant crabs? Check. Hidden elf enclave guarded by intoxicating illusions? It's there. Ominous mountain with entrance to underworld dungeon labyrinth? Come and see what there is to see, if you dare! Gorgeous regional map by illustrator DC Stow.
📗 More than 30 detailed and unique regions, each with their own flavor and random encounter tables. Each zone is something different to experience, with unique flora and fauna and flavorful landscape features. No matter which way the adventurers go, there's something special about where they end up.
📗 Powerful and petty factions who vie for power across the vast territory. Each faction is detailed with agendas, agents, leaders, allies, and enemies. Play them against the adventurers and watch the sparks fly!
📗 9 steadings (some safe, some not) for adventurers to carouse, resupply, recover, hear rumors, and accept quests. Presented clearly with notable NPCs, shops, and establishments detailed with only the most useful and flavorful bits. Beautiful custom maps by illustrator DC Stow.
Prototype City Map - Click for Alpha Preview PDF
Prototype Lanternlight Map created with Watabou's City Generator - Final version to be fully illustrated by DC Stow.
Prototype Hex Map. Click to see full-sized version.
Prototype hex map is hand-drawn and digitally colored by Zack Wolf. He is proud of it. DC Stow will do the final map in a similar style and it will be even more awesome!
Hex Examples. Roll for random encounter if needed. Hidden things in italics.
📙 Book #2 focuses on the overland map dungeons, monsters, and treasures. Grab this one if you want a bunch of neat, old-school dungeons to drop into your existing campaign. Use with book #1 for the full experience!
📙 More than a dozen dungeons, ranging in size from small to huge, for adventurers to plunder and die in. Dungeons are designed to be easy to use at the table, putting the important "need to know" facts right up front, followed by the less obvious details that require some examination or interaction to uncover. Beautiful custom maps by illustrator DC Stow.
📙 A horde of horrendous monsters lurking in darkness, ready for you to unleash upon the world. Monsters aren't scary because they have a lot of hit points or a high armor class, they're scary because they're vicious, clever, relentless, and unpredictable. Some familiar, some never before seen.
📙 An array of amazing new OSR-style magical items and curious artifacts. Items are designed to be simple, evocative, and useful. Some might be cool and powerful weapons, but most just make for entertaining problem solving and creative utility.
Example Dungeon Room. Bold is for obvious stuff, ready to read aloud. Regular text needs interaction. Italic requires searching. Monsters are small caps.
Example Dungeon Map - Artwork by DC Stow

campaign.story:
Merchants of Multiverse is a 32 page, saddle stitched, B&W, 5.5” x 8.5” zine for Mutant Crawl Classics and other OSR-style systems. It can be used to make your post-apocalyptic or interstellar game feel more alive and active. It contains the following:
 Over 50 new artifacts of the ancients!
 Rules for buying and selling artifacts 
 7 colorful merchants from around the multiverse!
A brand new MCC adventure!
Amazing and original art from Boson Au!
 Tables for trading and travel
Tips for MCC-ifying those DCC modules 
What is Mutant Crawl Classics?
Mutant Crawl Classics is a roleplaying game designed and published by Goodman Games. It's a combination of science fiction and fantasy, inspired by The Dying Earth series by Jack Vance, Thundarr the Barbarian (1980-82), Zardoz (1974), Wizards (1977), and Empire of the East by Fred Saberhagen, alongside all the things you'd expect in other classic roleplaying games. It’s Sword and Sorcery after the world has forgotten what ruined civilization! Say “NO” to a depressing end of the world. We love our mutations, A.I. deities, plant people, and gophermen!

And even if you don’t play (or own) MCC, it still has HD, and AC and stuff you’d find in other OSR, and D20 systems!
The Team
Merchants of Multiverse is written by Stefan Surratt and Boson Au.

Stefan Surratt has worked as a contributor to the 2020 GongFarmer’s Almanac and QuaranZine. For the GFA, he wrote Dead Dragon Peak and did layout on Volume 2. He had 1 magic item and 1 spell appear in QuaranZine 1. In QuaranZine 2: The Funnel, he wrote The Immortal Ooze Engine, and did all layout and editing. He will be doing editing and layout for this zine. Follow his Twitter @DMBadWrongFun

Boson Au has worked as a contributor, both written word and art, for QuaranZine.  He provided illustrations and art for QuaranZine 1. For QuaranZine 2: The Funnel, He wrote and illustrated The Return of Monguandu as well as the cover art for that zine. He also contributed art to the 2020 Gongfarmer’s Almanac: illustrations and cartography for B Mine in Volume 6 and Patron Bond Vision Quest Rules in Volume 8. You can see more of his work at www.instagram.com/typicalbreakfast
 Stretch Goals
The more Merchants of the Multiverse gets funded, the better it gets!
$1000 – 4 pages of original monsters, fully illustrated and ready to creep out of dimensional cracks and into your game!
$1500 – 4-pages of strange communities and travelers to meet. Scarcity and surplus are the markers of any economy!
$2200 – 4-pages of tables and adventure seeds for all mercantile events and mishaps!
$3500 – 8-pages of adventure seed tables each merchant and extra art!
$5000 - ???? We’ll listen to what backers want and make it happen!
Rewards
PDFs will be fulfilled through DriveThruRPG.

Your shipping is included in your pledge as long as you are a backer in the United States. Shipping is processed via media mail. We do not feel confident in delivering products internationally at this time, but we do plan on offering a PoD option in the future through DriveThruRPG. Our ETD on fulfillment is getting all products shipped out in July of 2021.

If you are a retailer interested in carrying Merchants of the Multiverse, please contact us here on Twitter or at DragonPeakPublishing@gmail.com.

campaign.story:
What is Bronx Beasts?
Bronx Beasts is a tabletop RPG where the players play mutant animals, or "Beasts," in a number of settings.  The game is inspired by Paladium's "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Other Strangeness" RPG, published in 1985, but uses the Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC RPG) rule system for quick and easy gameplay. 
Who am I?
I've enjoyed tabletop RPG's since getting the Frank Metzner ("red box") edition of Basic Dungeons & Dragons in 1983 at the tender age of 8 years old.  I've enjoyed gaming in the decades since, and after discovering DCC RPG in 2016 and attending Gary Con IX in 2017, I was inspired to write and design games rather than just play them.
The author and his Jr. High School chums gaming at Gary Gygax’s house, Lake Geneva 2017
I released the Bronx Beasts Volume 1 zine in time to hand out copies to a lucky few at Gary Con XI in 2019 with all sorts of great ideas for adventures and crazy random tables to fuel adventures in the worlds of Bronx Beasts yet to come.  Volume 1 contains all the game rules needed for creating Beast class player characters and new game play mechanics, including Evolution Points, Bestial Freakouts, and Fur Burn, and is fully compatible with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game (DCC RPG).   I also released a zero-level funnel adventure called "The Handoff" for Bronx Beasts in the 2019 volume of the Gongfarmer's Almanac, a free unofficial zine for DCC RPG. 
Since then, I've been writing and testing additional adventure material for Bronx Beasts, and have explored other adventure settings for Beasts to roam beyond my original vision of a fictionalized mid-1980's New York City with the "Ninja" knob cranked up to 11. 
What are these Zines About?
This Kickstarter is to fund no less than 8 volumes of Bronx Beasts zines, which will be available in digital and print format.  
Bronx Beasts Volume 1 is already complete but needs to be reprinted, as I only have about 30 copies left from the first printing.  I plan to fix the one typo that I'm aware of in that volume, but otherwise make no changes.  This volume is 44 pages long, and this is the first time it is available in a digital format.
Bronx Beasts Volume 1 Cover and Table of Contents, artwork by Clayton Williams
Bronx Beasts Volumes 2 - 5 comprise a four-part campaign built around an 1980's-era story chock full of mutated animals, ninjas, leg warmers, glowing goo, bare-chested commandos, and every other '80's trope I could think to include.  The adventures follow a group of Beasts from 1st through 4th level as they uncover the mystery of their own origins as well as take on the shadowy organizations responsible for a deadly new drug that is flooding the streets of the Big Apple.  The campaign takes up 4 separate zine volumes, split up into individual adventures in a "point crawl" style campaign across, below, and above the City that Never Sleeps.   Additional setting material, random encounters, and villainous personalities are included to encourage exciting adventures and story development between the campaign's main plot points.
The Big Bop Back to Brooklyn is a stand-alone adventure for Bronx Beasts in a single zine volume.  More than one player of my Bronx Beasts games have enthusiastically told me they would love to see a Bronx Beasts adventure based on the 1979 film "The Warriors."  I decided to take on this challenge, and dozen screenings of the film, a couple of readings through the original novel, and a few play tests has resulted in an adventure that I feel captures the essence of this story into a great adventure, dropping Beasts into the roles of street gangs on a hot New York City summer night.
The Island of Lost Souls is my riff on H.G. Well's "The Island of Dr. Moreau," with a nod to director Richard Stanley's vision for the doomed 1996 film of the same name. These zines provide information about the Island in a sandbox campaign setting and provides a series of adventures following the Beasts living on the Island.  Random tables, monsters, encounters, and a full map of the Island and its key locations are provided to encourage as much use out of this sandbox as possible.
All volumes are expected to be between 32 and 48 pages long, and print copies will be black and white with cardstock covers.  Shipping for US backers is already included in the cost for all pledge levels that involve printed copies.  Printed copies will be  shipped out as soon as they're available, with PDF copies being made available 2 weeks prior to the physical zine releases.
More images from Volume 1, artwork by Erik Breese & Dan Steeby
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have experience with desktop publishing and game design, and have published similar material before, having released Bronx Beasts Volume 1 and "The Handoff" Adventure in 2019. I have also worked on the Gongfarmer's Almanac, a free unofficial zine for the DCC RPG since 2017 in various roles, including handling writing, editing, and layout duties for that publication.

Bronx Beasts Volume 1 is complete and there is virtually no risk for backing this item, I just need to reprint it as I've only got about 30 copies left from my 1st print run. This volume will be available to backers in March 2021.

The material for the other zines in this Kickstarter campaign is new, but is already written and some of it is already in desktop publishing software, just waiting for artwork. Other volumes will still require some organizing and final play testing, which I'll be doing at game conventions and in private play tests throughout 2021. There is little risk for any of this as far as the writing work goes as I consider everything I'm putting out to be at least 80% written at this time. I've put the most 'ready for release' items first in the release schedule, with The Island of Lost Souls Volumes 1 and 2 scheduled for completion in August 2021, The Big Bop Back to Brooklyn scheduled for October 2021, and Bronx Beasts Volumes 2 - 5 scheduled for February 2022.

My main risk is coordinating with and funding the artists that will be involved in making original artwork for these zines. Pricing for artwork that I've gotten estimates from so far range between $30 and $50 per piece, with larger pieces such as covers costing more. My goal is to have at least one piece of artwork for every 4 pages of zine, meaning I'm expecting at least $400 per volume in artwork expenses. I'm addressing this risk by making sure I know what to expect from the artists' rates at the outset of the project and budgeting accordingly, working with artists I've worked with on other projects before or are well know assets within the indie RPG artwork scene, and by coordinating a pool of artists to provide material for this project so I'm not leaning too heavily on any single artist for the project, which could delay the planned release schedule.

March came and went like a lion!  I had a great time running Bronx Beasts sessions at Virtual Gary Con, thanks to those of you that joined me for those sessions.  I got another round of play testing in on the Big Bop Back to Brooklyn adventure as well as one of the adventures for the Island of Lost Souls and much fun was had by all participants. Bronx Beasts Volumes 2 - 5 will contain the campaign that I wrote and ran for my local friends while writing the game rules for Bronx Beasts.  The campaign was split into 4 parts, which of course lends itself well to being split into zine volumes to break the plot up into logical chunks.  The adventure takes Beasts from the sewers to the rooftops of highest skylines of the Big Apple and many points between as they quest to discover the mystery of their origins as well as work to rid the city of criminal plots involving the hottest new drug to hit the streets, investigate stories of homeless being snatched from the streets, never to be seen again, and struggle against no less than 4 criminal factions that are turning the gears of the criminal underworld in this campaign.  And, keeping to this rule of 4, the campaign is designed to take Beasts from experience level 1 through 4 as they progress through the adventure.

Hi all, here's a closer look at the Big Bop Back to Brooklyn adventure, a plug for a friend's campaign, and a brief artwork update!
My introduction to the film "The Warriors" was via Twisted Sister's "Come Out And Play" album, released in 1985.  The album's title, title song, and intro are clearly nods to a certain famous scene in the film.  It was not until years later that I actually watched the film, but when I finally got around to it, it made an impression on me nearly as strong as my 10-year-old self had been impressed by the face makeup and searing vocals of Dee Snider.  The comic book-esque introduction and scene changes combined with the outlandish gangs in the dirty, garish backdrop of New York City provided visual imagery that presented a different take on gang life and New York.  Watching it immediately called to my mind the colorful 'first wave' of NYC hip hop artists in the vein of the Furious Five, Sugar Hill Gang, Zulu Nation, and Public Enemy.  The movie was about walking the streets and skin rumbles, which was a very different take than the NYC that I grew up seeing in action films from the '80's and '90's, as cinematic crime had evolved from fistfights in the park to drive-by shootings and portrayed nearly every citizen armed to the teeth.

campaign.story:
The Haunted Hamlet and other hexes is a zine detailing four unique modular locations for your game. 
Made for old school essentials, but can easily be used with other old-school systems or even 5E. All in a compact zine format.
The four locations detailed in the zine focus on gameable content and being easy to use at the table. The locations are not connected to one another and can be sprinkled onto your campaign map however you like, or run as one shots. The zine is graphic and art heavy and utilizes a lot of random tables and other tools to make it easier for GMs to run in a pinch.
Each hex location has its own tone and scenario and they are not related to each other. They each are complete with hooks for your players, timelines of events to keep the pace of the game moving, as well as unique monsters and NPCs. The hexes are designed to be low-prep to run with a focus on what information is needed at the table.
The Haunted Hamlet
Example Hex : The Hat Cult's Hideout
Three weeks ago, an apprentice stole a powerful fusion device and a number of magical hats from a wizard he was studying under. He brought the device to an abandoned cave in a wood, frustrated that the wizard never used the device. He began combining random animals he found out of curiosity, thinking they probably prefer to be fused. Who wants to be just one thing anyway? He recruited some others from a local town who were interested to come live in the cave to learn magic and together they formed the hat cult. 
Each new member receives one of the magical hats upon initiation. There are now 10 members, and with endless curiosity they combine different creatures in the device. Seeing themselves as visionaries at ground zero, ushering in a new age were people will finally be satisfied and complete as fusion beings. Nothing excites the members more than ideas of new combinations, while the creatures they have already created are set loose in the woods and quickly forgotten about. It seems each creation is a bit of a disappointment to the cult once its created, not as exciting as the initial idea was. This frenzied cycle has been continuing for weeks. Dangerous creatures are now leaking out of the woods and into surrounding villages, causing all kinds of problems. 
The Hat Cult's Hideout Hex Contains: 
A Timeline of events 
Hooks for your players 
A magical creature generator 
A map of the Hat cult's Hideout 
Stats for the Cultists 
Prompts and resolutions for what happens if players take different actions 
A "whats currently going on?" table 
A list of magical head wear
Artwork
All four hexes will contain stats compatible with the old school essentials rule system.
Trim size : 5.5” x 8.5”
100 gsm paper stapled with 110 gsm cardstock cover
Black & White
Printed with Mixam
28 + pages
The PDF will have hyperlinks and bookmarks
Pledge for two zines and you will receive my previous zinequest project - Willow
Willow is a grim backwater town that can be dropped into your campaign. It is a 36 page zine printed in one color tone on 100 gsm paper with 110 gsm matt laminated cover. The micro setting is complete with NPCs, Random tables, a dungeon, maps and a timeline of events. It works well either as a starting town for a new campaign or as a town players discover in an existing campaign. 
If you pledge at this level than you get some original hand-drawn artwork from the zine mailed to you! First come, first served. I will send your artwork out before you receive your zine, shipping is included.

REWARD LEVELS 
ART PRINT STRETCH GOALS 
For each stretch goal hit, additional content will be unlocked. If you back at any level which includes art prints you will receive an additional cardstock A5 black and white print for each unlocked stretch goal. These will be printed front and back. You will receive the PDFs of all unlocked content if you back at any level. 
I'm Lazy Litch, a dungeon master, artist, graphic designer and OSR content creator from Ireland but currently living in Canada. I previously self published a book called Woodfall which is now a platinum best seller on drivethrurpg. I also collaborated on an adventure book for Swords and Wizardry called Spiral Isles. Last year I published a project called Willow for zinequest.

This is the fourth Kickstarter I have been involved in. Previously I ran the successful Woodfall campaign in 2018. I also collaborated on Spiral Isles and Desert Dwellers in 2019. I then ran a zinequest project called Willow in 2020. All of these projects were successfully funded and fulfilled. I have intentionally kept things very simple with minimal stretch goals so I can focus on delivering a great product without delays.

The only work on the Zine that I am not doing myself is the editing and play-testing, so I can avoid any delays and budget issues that might arise from hiring artists and graphic designers. Printing delays and delivery errors are always possible. Its also possible that the delays in the US post system due to a reduced workforce from covid cases will continue. But I am working with a reliable printer and I will be working on this project full time.

The Bad Guyz have taken over!  Drug lords, street gangs, and crooked cops have the city in a stranglehold!
You and your crew have rediscovered the lost secrets of the Ninja and it is time to take back your turf!
Welcome to Ninja City!
Ninja City is a RPG zine in which players take the roles of ninjas in a VHS-inspired action world.  Rules are based on the Dungeon Crawl Classics roleplaying game.  
Ninja City is where Kosugi, Dudikoff, Storm Shadow, and the manager from the sword store at the mall all come together on a Saturday afternoon to party hard and throw some stars.
 Contents includes:
S.W.O.R.D.Z.- A new ninja-centric attribute system!
Kuji-In Hand Seals- Based on DCC RPG spells, the Ninja gains access to supernatural powers! 
Ninja combat and special moves rules!
Tables for: Day Jobs, Hideouts, Senseis,  Contraband, and Bad Guyz!
Rise of the Metal-Psychos- A mini one-shot adventure framework to get the action going!
And much more!
Grab some smoke bombs, a boom box, and a slice of pepperoni.  It is time to clean house in...
Ninja City! 
To get the most out of Ninja City, you need to grab a DCC RPG rulebook, as spells and core rules will not be reprinted in the zine.  This is a light, fun game perfect for one-shots.
Rewards
Keeping it simple:  For ten clams, you get the PDF and the physical zine in the US.  If you would like multiple copies, pledge the appropriate increment of $10, and you will get the additional copies.  
Digital: PDFs will be distributed through DriveThruRPG
Physical: Ninja City will be approximately 24 pages of 5.5 x 8.5 sized paper. It will be staple-bound and contain black and white art.  We will ship to the US through USPS. Shipping for US backers is included in your pledge. At this point, shipping outside the US is not being offered due to postage costs.

The Team
Rev. Joey Royale:  Concept and Writing
The Rev. is hot off the release of DARKEST DICE, a successful RPG Kickstarter that met its projected fulfillment in Dec. 2020 and continues to spread across the land.  His other DCC RPG-related project ONE OF US  will be in mailboxes soon.  Ninja City is his tribute to the glory of the 80's ninja explosion and to the magic that is DCC RPG.

Joseph Guillette:  Art and Design 
Joseph began his career in TV and Film in 2000 and managed the very first web show on TV, I Bet You Will as art director and co-host. A year later, the company made the Academy nominated, Super Size Me with Joseph as its art and animation director. 

Since then he's worked as a storyboard artist for film, TV and commercials.  He also does graphic design and original art for production companies, musicians, and festivals. His work regularly appears on Law & Order SVU.  He continues to package concepts for TV and Film with several production companies and individual writers. 

Joseph resides in Connecticut painting, drawing, sign-making, and publishing his own online comic strips
Ninja City is a proud supporter of Zine Quest 3

A blood-curdling scream rings out, traveling in the autumn air. A door slams. The sound of something breaking branches tears through the brush and is followed by several sharp, unnatural barks. Then, near silence as the wind kicks up. The only thing heard for the next few moments is the rustling of the wind and blowing leaves.
Wide-eyed Terror is a compact DCC RPG -compatible roadside encounter for 12-16 0-level characters or 5-6 level-1 characters. It details 13 individual areas, but plays as a tense, fast-paced encounter with multiple moving parts as the party inevitably splits up. It will take 1.5-2 hours for your players to complete. 
Wide-eyed Terror takes place at a semi-isolated farmstead which can be placed right off of a road between towns, or can simply be stumbled upon as part of a hex crawl. It can also be used as an alternate set-up to The Precipice of Corruption, or to continue that adventure.
Writing and Art Credits:
Most of the writing was done by myself, Nick Baran. This time Jamie Jordan and myself will be handling all of the art and cartography duties. Find Jamie Jordan @noirfade on Instagram.
Zine Stats: This zine is slated to be 20-24 pages, saddle stitched. The interior will be black and white on 60# text and the cover will be black on colored 65# cover stock. This zine will be printed at DigiCopy, here in Milwaukee, WI.
The Goal:
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise the funds to print 100 copies of this 20-24 page zine. Additional money will fund additional copies, stickers, and art for future projects.
 What is Dungeon Crawl Classics? 
Glory & Gold Won by Sorcery & Sword
You’re no hero.
You’re an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended you to, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page…
Rules Set: DCC RPG, an OGL system that cross-breeds Appendix N with a streamlined version of 3E.
Support: Goodman Games supports DCC RPG with an extensive line of adventure modules and select other materials.

campaign.story:
Old School  & Cool Volume 2 is just as RAD as the first installment, but twice as crazy! This time we take our talents to a wretched future, replete with mutant apes, giant robots, and wasteland marauders! Do you have what it takes to survive?
If OS&C Vol 1 was a mix of goodies, Vol 2 is a laser-focused setting/sourcebook/style guide for future fun.
Think of it as Old School Essentials meets RIFTS meets your worst nightmares!
What will it look like?
40 pages of skull-crushing old school awesomeness!
Tons of art and cool hand-lettered titles.
Saddle Stitched
Printed locally at 5.5" x 8.5" in black and white
Wraparound FULL COLOR card stock cover
Here's the breakdown:
Wind draws all the art.
Ahimsa comes up with crazy ideas and writes most of the words.
Wind does lay-out.
We all play a few sessions of RIFTS, TMNT, and Shadowrun (for research purposes)
Leslie makes sure that we stay on task.
How Old School is Cool?
No lie: we play just about everything, from Chainmail to 5e, but our favorite flavor is the B/X style OSR. So you're going to find that just about everything we have in here fits that mold. That means Old School & Cool vol. 2 is 100% compatible with Old-School Essentials, the Gold Standard of Old School Gaming! 
But it will also work equally well with Knave, Labyrinth Lord, White Box, or whatever OSR system you choose to use.
If you like to play later versions of the game, most of our awesome stuff will still fit--especially things like inns and menus--but the classes and spells might take a little tweaking.
So what's in the book? Here you go:
 New Sci-Fi Classes! Think you can survive a post-apoc hellscape? Maybe you can, if you play as one of our Mutant Apes, Mech Masters, or Wasteland Warriors.
 Awesome Vehicles! Killer bikes, wasteland contraptions, modded hot-rods, spider-mechs, oh my!

 Rules for Psychic Combat! The ultimate battle is a battle of the mind!
 Random Tables! Ahimsa is the master of randomness!
 A Mini-Adventure in the Far Future! Packed with surprises and a totally rad map!
PSYCHIC COMBAT!
Digital Orders Fulfilled Through DriveThru RPG
SPECIAL EDITION COVER!
If you like collecting things, or if you are just a fan of KILLER ARTWORK, we are making a select number of special edition 2-color  Risograph covers that Wind will hand print at Outlet PDX. 
(It's a WIP)
Don't just take our word for it!
(Chris @ Tabletops and Tentacles)
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFhN_HoNjGA 
Reviews for Old School & Cool vol. 1
“In terms of tone, it goes all out! Crazy ideas balanced with good mechanical design. The over-the-top classes all make sense mechanically…My thoughts can be broadly categorized into:’I’d love to throw this at my friends in our game.’ or ‘I’d love to show this to my friend so he can make use of it when he DMs (and I can play an Augur).’ – Third Eye Openers 
“[I]t has consistent art, varied content, and is a pool of ideas to pick and choose for your games at an affordable price…With a stroke of luck we will get future issues of Old School & Cool.” – The Man with a Hammer 
A note on shipping
We plan to ship this zine as cheaply as possible--which means that they will be sent out in 6x9 28-pound brown kraft envelopes. And we might have to split shipments for international backers who purchase two physical zines so we can pay the letter postage rate.
If you want it in a box, you'll have to let us know when we do the backer survey (costs for shipping boxes will vary by location, but will be around $3.00 more for the US and $10-15 more for international shipping.)
We will not be covering VAT or duties in our shipping prices. This will be up to the buyer if and when necessary.
How Old School are You?

No Stretch Goals
We want to get this book to you ASAP,  so there are no bells and whistles to hinder the process.

I still have a small handful of shipments left to send out to individual backers who requested info on upgraded shipping but haven't yet responded to our follow-up email. If you're one of those backers, I'll ship them out standard this weekend if I don't hear anything else from you--and sooner if I do.

Ahimsa sent out pdfs yesterday. I picked up the printed zines today. I'll be packaging and labelling them this week and hope to get them out in the mail sometime next week. They are super cool!
If you backed at a pdf level and you didn't receive your download link, please let us know.
 Check out the pics!

Hey all--
I just picked up the Special Edition risograph covers from Outlet PDX and they look awesome! We're going to have a few extra (but just a few!), so let me know if you're interested in upgrading and we can get you set up.
I also sent off the files to the printer, will be dropping off these covers tomorrow, and should have final books by sometime next week! We sent out a backer survey last week and most of you have responded. Remember--we're sending these in plain manilla envelopes to save you money on shipping. If you want a rigid mailer and don't mind paying a bit extra, we can do it--but you need to let us know.

I just wrapped layout on Old School & Cool Volume 2. Now Ahimsa is doing the line-edits and the Special Edition covers are getting printed at Outlet PDX as I type. 
The final PDF versions should be ready to go out in the next week or so and I anticipate that the printed copies should be ready about a week after that!

Hey all, Old School & Cool is coming along swimingly! Here's a brief update:
The vehicle combat rules are written and have been thoroughly playtested and  approved. 
Classes are almost done--we've finished the Simians (mutant apes), Motorheads, Mutants, and some kind of Human 2.0 and just need to finish up the Replicant/Androids. (Here's a look at the Simian level titles, written with the help of you, our backers:)

We did it, everyone! Thanks again for all of your support :D
Work is progressing really well on the Zine--it's about 50% written now and Ahimsa is hard at work on the other 50%. 
We playtested the vehicle combat and evasion rules yesterday and, after making a few changes here and there, feel pretty confident that the system is simple, effective, and fun.

I just finished writing the vehicle rules for evasion and chases and I'm pretty excited with how they turned out! I kept is simple in the OSE vein but added enough intensity for some proper post-apoc road warrior stuff. Check it out:

The campaign is chugging along and now we're already in the home stretch. Thank you so much to all of you who have backed this project and shared about it on social media. 
I have been doing a bunch of drawings (one of my new favorites is attached) and Ahimsa has been working diligently on those random future tables. I have some really good ideas for equipment, weapons and armor, which I am writing up at this very moment.

Things are progressing well with OS&C2--Ahimsa has been coming up with some great weapons and item tables and I have been doing some more sketching. 
I have been raiding my old TMNT and After the Bomb books for inspiration and just rewatched the original Ghost in the Shell--now I'm ready to draw some more killer future stuff!

campaign.story:
Horns up for every hesher who ever tossed dice, beheaded the evil warlock-king and looted all his sweet magic crap - this is the zine for you!
Following up on the success of our RPG zines The Phylactery and The Phylactery 2, Planet X Games is stoked to bring you an all-new, all-different zine dedicated to weird fantasy magical items and artifacts with a heavy metal vibe. Magic and Shit is a cover-to-cover 48-page, saddle-stitched, 5.5-inch by 8.5-inch B&W printed zine with a bad ass color cover by Planet X favorite (and consumate, lifelong metalhead) Lawrence Hernandez. Like all of our zines, this poser-free fanzine is stacked with a ton of new plug-n-play content that you can drop directly into your fantasy role playing games. No rambling charts or useless page-filler to suck up space - just our usual grindhouse-style content infused with some denim and leather love for the 70s-80s metal scene.
Covert art for Magic and Shit by Lawrence Hernandez
The magical items in this zine have been designed to bring something a little weird and altogether new to your campaign, while still giving a knowing nod to the games of yore that we all love and remember so fondly. What will your players do when confronted with the Mummified Hand of Gilly Yonder? Dare they slip on the Graveshroud of Nanthos the Black? What the hell is a Corpsehatch Seed? Dare they summon the dread powers of the Moaning Head of St Barach?
This zine is full of surprises and all-new takes on magical treasures to keep your players guessing. Will they partake of the Blood of the Bol-Gatha and harness the power of the Faceless One? Will they read aloud the Screed of Black Lore and gain the powers of darkness for themselves? Perhaps a villain is in possession of the Ossuary of Yeth and its only a matter of time before the players find themselves at the mercy of howling demons from the great beyond? With options galore, there's a hundred ways to make this zine a staple at your tabletop game. 
The High-Flyin' Jawbone of Cutter Wotts and the Ossuary of Yeth by Adrian Landeros
SO WHAT'S IN THIS DAMN OLE THING ANYWAYS?
Magic and Shit contains 30+ magical items and artifacts that are fully detailed and ready to play at your table. This isn't one of those books where you get a couple of lines about statistics and then we move on - we're giving you full descriptions, a little history and a plug-n-play plot hook for every entry, along with killer art by Planet X favorites like Adrian Landeros and Lawrence Hernandez.
The cliche "don't judge a book by its cover" doesn't apply to Magic and Shit, because what you see is absolutely what you get! The entire zine has a feel and aesthetic that is directly influenced from our favorite metal albums. When pitching this project, we wanted it to have the same feel as popping the shrink on a newly purchased copy of Metallica's Master of Puppets or Black Sabbath's Master of Reality, with no guess as to what might actually be inside aside from pure badassery. Magic and Shit was directly inspired by our love of heavy metal albums from the 70s and 80s. We're channeling Iron Maiden's Powerslave, Cannibal Corpse's Butchered at Birth and Judas Priest's Screaming for Vengeance. We're disciples at the altar of legendary cover artists like Doug Johnson, Derek Riggs, Pushead, Joe Petagno, Vincent Locke and Ed Repka. Eddie, Snaggletooth and Vic Rattlehead are our co-pilots!
The Mummified Hand of Gilly Yonder by Adrian Landeros
THE TEAM
Magic and Shit is written by lifelong metalhead Levi Combs, who has published a number of adventure modules through Planet X Games. He has also been a writer on several projects for FGG, Necromancer Games and Mudpuppy Games. You can find him at @it_came_from_beyond_planet_x on Instagram.
Adrian Landeros is an uber-talented illustrator who has done work for a variety of game publishers including FGG, Necromancer Games and Planet X Games. His full color covers and beautiful black and white interiors are equally impressive, but his interior illustrations for Magic and Shit capture the aesthetic and vibe of the zine perfectly. You can find him at @ghoster9 on Instagram.
The Assassin’s Sash and Blasphemous Eidolon of the Outer Gods by Adrian Landeros
Tracey Steele is the unsung layout and design hero of Planet X Games, since she's the one that makes all these books look so great in the first place. Its been a real pleasure to work with her over so many projects and she brings an enthusiasm and work ethic to these projects that is unmatched. You can find her at @fossiedesign on Instagram.
Je Shields is a freelance illustrator with credits in the RPG industry that reads like a what's what of bad ass projects. His Patreon is one of the best I have ever seen and you can find him at @j_e_shields on Instagram.
Lawrence Hernandez is one of the most imaginative artists I've ever met. He has done illustrations for almost all of the releases from Planet X Games, in addition to numerous artistic projects of his own. He's back with the glorious cover to this zine, along with a handful of interior illustrations. You can find him at @lawrence_hernandez_arts on Instagram.
The Graveshroud of Nanthos the Black by Adrian Landeros
HOW TO PLEDGE FOR MULTIPLE COPIES
If a single copy won't do it for you or you need to order for a friend, we've got options for getting multiple copies of the Magic and Shit zine. No need to bargain your soul to blasphemous elder entities - just select the pledge level for the PRINT + PDF and fill out the dollar amount in multiples of $15 (i.e., $30 for two copies, $45 for three copies, etc).
RETAILER PLEDGE LEVEL
One of the things Planet X Games has always been proud of is our support for the FLGS - those brick and mortar Friendly Local Game Stores. In these strange times we've found ourselves in, we need them more than ever. If you are a retailer, this is the pledge level for you!
SHIPPING
Each and every Magic and Shit zine will be carefully packaged and shipped to backers via USPS in a non-bendable carboard envelope with multiple ”DO NOT BEND” stickers. Kickstarter has recommended that all shipping and handling costs should NOT be included in your pledge levels. Shipping and handling is $5 and add-ons come at an extra $2 each. If i can get it cheaper for you, I will. Retailer shipping comes via media mail and is also only $5.
ALL SHIPPING FOR PRINT ZINES IS FOR THE UNITED STATES ONLY, so please make your pledges accordingly. Current international shipping costs are so ridiculously high and unreasonable that it is simply not feasible for Planet X Games at this time. Its unfortunate and we're not happy about it, but larger companies than us have tried and failed, despite the resources at their disposal. There's something about shipping a $15 book for $32 that just sticks in our craw. We just can't get behind that and can only offer up apologies with hopes that shipping costs will become more manageable in the future.
Bloodyguts’ Bone Rattle and Corpsehatch Seeds by Adrian Landeros
STRETCH GOALS
We're doing a little something different this time - instead of putting in a ton of stretch goals, we're just gonna go ahead and have faith in the Doom-Gods of the Wild Hinterlands and blow the zine out to it's 48 page maximum. The entirety of the funds raised by this project are going straight back into the book in order to get you the kind of off-brand, indie content you've come to expect from Planet X Games.
ADD-ONS
Did you miss out on any of our previous projects? No worries - we've got you covered! Add-ons will be available in Backerkit, so youre good to go!
Jungle Tomb of the Mummy Bride ($21 backer-only price)
Tales of the cursed pyramid and the sleeping tomb of the Mummy Bride have long been a traveler’s tale, passed along by wayward explorers and greedy plunderers alike. Deep within the verdant jungles of the south, amidst a Green Hell of impenetrable jungle, savage cannibals and ancient myth, lies the shattered remnants of a once-powerful civilization and the terrible gods who ruled over them. Rumors swirl of untold riches and un-plundered magic for those brave (or foolish!) enough to claim it. Will your players survive… and what will be left of them? Jungle Tomb of the Mummy Bride is a 5E adventure module suitable for levels 5-7.
An Occurrence at Howling Crater ($29 backer-only price)
Brutal tales of the desolate, unforgiving wasteland known as Howling Crater have long caused travelers and caravan masters to give it a wide berth, but now fresh accounts of depravity and madness have begun to circulate out of that forbidden wasteland. Deep within the barren recesses of the crater, a murderous family of inbred, mutated crater folk have begun to preach the gospel of the "the glory of the glow" and with it has come incurable sickness and murderous incursions across the land. Even stranger rumors have made the rounds as of late, whispering of a long-forgotten civilization of steel and fire, born in a swirling inferno of radioactive dust and powered by ancient alien astronaut-gods, lost deep within the crater's recesses.
Can your characters fight their way past this mutated, maniacal cult of alien-worshipping hillbillies to explore the truth of Howling Crater? Do they dare penetrate the inner mysteries of an ancient crashed ship and put a stop to the biological terrors that now run loose? Will they discover the true, terrifying secret behind the horrible happenings at Howling Crater?!
An Occurrence at Howling Crater is a 5E adventure module suitable for levels 7-9.
Escape from Skullcano Island ($47 backer-only price)
Ominous signs have been sweeping across the land. Forbidding skies stained the color of blood. Thunderous, bestial sounds roaring from across the sea. Natural disasters of all varieties are raging uncontrollably across the land. Through it all, rumors swirl of strangely-clad heretics and wild-eyed blasphemers running amok, whispering prophecies of annihilation. What is happening… and why?
Learned folk of every race have assembled with the most renowned oracles and seers of our age in an effort to discover what is truly happening. They all point to one place as the source of their collective woe – the primeval jungles and untouched shores of the legendary Skullcano Island!
Escape from Skullcano Island is a hardback 5E adventure module suitable for levels 15-20.
Glimmering Crypt of the Ioun King ($21 backer-only price)
Tavern tales and campfire talk across the land whisper of a glittering, gem-laden tomb deep beneath the sunlit lands of the surface, the final resting place of a doomed dwarven wizard who delved deep into the heart of the earth seeking answers… but found something else.  Something went awry deep within those cyclopean vaults far beneath the surface, unleashing something that wasn't meant for the mortal world. What happened to this famed dwarven wizard... and does danger still lurk in the Glimmering Crypt of the Ioun King?
Glimmering Crypt of the Ioun King is a 5E adventure module suitable for level 5-7.
The Phylactery zine No. 1 ($10 backer-only price)
The Phylactery is a cover-to-cover 48-page, saddle-stitched, 5.5-inch by 8.5-inch B&W printed zine with a bad ass color cover by Planet X favorite Ed Bickford. This booklet is jam packed with page after page of heroic fantasy adventure influenced heavily by early third party RPG badassery like Dave Hargrave’s infamous  Arduin Grimoire series and the early Dragontree Press stuff. The Phylactery is meant to be a quick and easy resource that you can pull ideas and plot hooks from for use directly at your gaming table. There’s no fluff in here and nothing padding out the page count - just pure old school goodness created exclusively for the fantasy gaming community. We have absolutely JAM-PACKED a ton of OSR goodness in here for you.
The Phylactery zine No. 2 ($10 backer-only price)
There was such an amazing reception to the first issue of The Phylactery that the creative team here at Planet X Games put together a sequel and this one is bigger, badder and louder in every respect, with the same heart and feel of the old school heroic fantasy RPGs we grew up playing back in the day. This is plug-n-play gaming at its best and the resources you find in these pages can be put directly to use in your home games. The Phylactery 2 is a cover-to-cover 48-page, saddle-stitched, 5.5-inch by 8.5-inch B&W printed zine with a full color cover by DC/Wildstorm comics artist Tony Avina and is packed full of OSR resources for your home table.

As it currently stands, this project is 100% written. Both cover and ALL interior art is turned in. We are waiting on the project to be funded before we compile the final PDFs, so they have not been hosted as of this writing. As with any crowdfunding program, the time between payment and delivery of the final product is subject to various risks, including the failure of the supplier, damage in shipment, disruptions within a company, as well as changes in the prices of materials and shipping. Having said that, we have a great reputation and a proven track record here on Kickstarter. We are ready to get this project moving and get it into your hands as soon as possible!

Having said that, we are in the age of COVID-19 and that has the chance to add its own set of challenges if things should take a turn. We work diligently to make sure our backers get their rewards on time and in good shape.

Zine #1
Unveiled Elisions
A collaboration RPG zine featuring articles from Donn Stroud and James A. Pozenel, Jr!
If you like post-apocalypse gaming, but would like the ability to easily adapt Mutant Crawl Classics to fit other post-apocalypse stories and other media, this zine is exactly what you're looking for. The Pure Strain Human as Class article presents a super easy system to build any sort of class drawing elements and skills from DCC RPG, MCC RPG, and DCC Lankhmar. It also includes examples of classes James made like a Gear Head, Treader of Wastes, Wasteland Minister, and more!
Contents
Pure Strain Human as Class by James A. Pozenel, Jr. 
Taming Mutated Mounts by Donn Stroud
Four new mounts for MCC RPG
Taming lore table
AND More
?? pages
5.5" x 8.5"
Mutant Mounts and Taming Lore By Craig Brasco
Zine #2
Scions of the Computarchs
A limited series from Horse Shark Games. Each issue of Scions of the Computarchs features a new patron AI suitable for use in your DCC & MCC RPG sci-fi campaigns. Two other patron AIs are planned for 2021. Issue #1 is a limited edition print, special only to this Kickstarter.
Issue #1: Erebus Network
The Erebus Network espouses mankind’s new savior, The Stream, via their holo-program, “Praise the Stream.” An excerpt of the program follows:
“Give yourself to The Stream. The Stream is so comforting, so soothing.” ~ Hades
"The data from The Stream is a beautiful mystery. Bits and packets and packets and bits... becoming packets of bits and bits of packets blending into little bickets of light... washing over you and cleansing and healing you. As you breathe in, observe the teeny-weeny bits of quantum radiation manifest in your being. As you breathe out, feel the warm glow... so soothing... so relaxing... Give yourself to The Stream." ~ Persephone
Erebus Network Sigil
16 pages
8.5" x 11"
Full Patron AI Write-up
5 Unique Programs (levels 1st to 5th)
Player’s Information Handout
Future issues will detail OMH-13, an android bent on human eradication, and Psyche/Net, an AI tasked with recording human personalities and the ability to replay the recorded personas. These future issues are planned as digital only and printed issues will not be available outside of this Kickstarter.
Zine #3
A series of "advent" ghost blog entries turned into a zine with art (hopefully a lot of art!). These are statted up for Old-School Essentials right now, and we will also be including DCC RPG stats. 
Here's one one the ghosts from the line up. More can be found at  Donn's blog. 
Advent Ghost #13: Expired Entanglement
Expired Entanglement
Sometimes, upon death, a body doesn't "give up the ghost," and these strange conjoined undead keep walking the living lands. The ghostly form can be seen trying to twist from the rotting body, while tugging the shambling corpse along.
Essentially these are two enemies and two targets, and they attack (and may be attacked) separately.
Corpse of Expired Entanglement
AC 7 [12] HD 3+2 (19 hp), Att 1 ×  weapon (1d8 or by weapon), THAC0 16 [+3], MV 90' (30’), SV D12 W13 P14 B15 S16 (3), ML 12, AL Chaotic, XP 50, NA 1d4 (1d4), TT NA
If the corpse reaches 0 hp, roll the Monster Reaction Roll again. On a 6+ the ghost will be released and fade away.
Undead: Make no noise until attacking. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading.
Ghost of Expired Entanglement
AC 3 [16] HD 4* (18hp), Att 1 ×  touch (1d8), THAC0 16 [+3], MV 120' (40’), SV D10 W11 P12 B13 S14 (4), ML 11, AL Chaotic, XP 125, NA 1d4 (1d4), TT NA
Undead: Make no noise until attacking. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading.
Mundane weapon immunity: Can only be damaged with silver or magical weapons.
If the spirit reaches 0 hp,  the corpse will be released and collapse.

What's the deal with DCC RPG and MCC RPG?
Dungeon Crawl Classics and Mutant Crawl Classics are published by Goodman Games. Joseph Goodman and his design team took the classic role playing game, stripped it down, and injected all the pure awesomeness of the Appendix N writings, and produced a glorious tome of RPG excellence that explodes with flavor and high octane attitude. DCC RPG is filled with luck pushing mechanisms that reward creative play while continually fueling spin off adventures that add to the narrative in amazingly fun play!
Mutant Crawl Classics (MCC) is technology & mutant role-playing game also published by Goodman Games. MCC returns players to the early days of sci-fi role-playing and pays homage to Gamma World & Metamorphosis Alpha. The system draws on the innovations that make DCC so popular, including Luck and random effects tables, but offers new races, classes, and artificially intelligent machines and patrons in a post-apocalyptic setting!
Find out more about Dungeon Crawl Classics and Mutant Crawl Classics at www.Goodman-Games.com.

What is Old-School Essentials?
A stunningly beautiful retro-clone of Basic in a modular set, restructured, and set up for optimal use while you play the game! OSE is published by Gavin Norman of Necrotic Gnome.

Hello, hello!
So, I can't believe this is the first update since February. Time flies.
Some art has come in. Layout is in the final stretches (sans art). I believe copy edits are nearly done. (I probably should have touched base with James before doing this update) In a perfect world we'll be wrapping every up in the next couple-several weeks and sending it off to the printer.

The KS is over and by gum we hit that final stretch goal of a foil cover! Sweet!
While we wait for funds to arrive, we are busy at work. As you already know Jayna Pavlin is working on the cover of Unveiled Elisions. The Pure Strain Human Class article is out for edit and most of the layout is finished. I've also asked Carmin Vance and Darrenn Canton to do some spot art for the Pure Strain Human class. Other pieces are in progress for edit and art is also being commissioned.

Greetings!
We've got around 9 hours left of this Zine Quest 3 campaign. It's been short and fun. There are sooo many amazing looking zines out there. It means a lot to both of us that you're still hanging on for some of this Post-Apocalyptic (and ghostly) goodness!
We did hit that first stretch goal so we'll be able to request a little more art.  We've got Jayna Pavlin working on one of the covers. Sean McCoy and Adam Forman are working on some interior art.

So the story starts a few years ago. We both had content lying around with no real home and we figured that we could do a zine. However, we were always busy with our own projects. I don't know what happened, but the stars finally aligned this year. Enchiridion and Forgotten Rites were both finished and in the backers hands in the fall; our calendars were free for something at the beginning of the year. So what's inside, you might be asking?

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Diary: Scions of the Computarchs
updates.update_content:
The Computarch Project began shortly after the release of MCC RPG. It was ambitious in scope.  Since I'd done a patron book for DCC RPG, I thought it would be appropriate to also write one for MCC RPG. After focusing on patron AIs, I also saw a need for generic wetware. The plan was an approximately 200 page book dedicated to both. Then COVID-19 hit.
It was just the beginning of the pandemic in the US, and I was uncertain about crowdfunding such a big and unfinished project. I typically wait until writing is finished so the project would not launch until we were well into the pandemic. So I cut scope to just generic wetware (the writing of which was nearly finished) and launched .
