campaign.story:
Clash-n-burn card game of world domination uses strategy and humor to mess with your opponents to help you rule the world. Based on 1990s award-winning game, Illuminati: New World Order. 1-6 players. Love of video games not required.
“…one of the more creative and innovating games out there.” —Illuminati: New World Order player review, Board Game Geek
“…the RadioFree.net team has impressed me with their level of communication, engagement, and commitment to this project. …this is shaping up to be one of my favorite projects out of the hundreds I’ve backed.” —M.H.
Illuminati Confirmed is a game of secret conspiracies, power systems, and a struggling resistance, under license from Austin’s legendary Steve Jackson Games. Newcomers and existing fans will love this updated twist on a classic, with incredible new artwork.

Attack and conquer to build your power structure with cards representing different aspects of our world—complete your pyramid and win! Fun, streamlined game-play. Conspiring and deceitful back-stabbing encouraged—necessary, really. See backer video for examples of gameplay.

The Servants of Cthulhu are back to destroy all! The global authoritarian Bavarian Illuminati meet their sworn enemy, the chaos-mongering Discordian Society! Will Big-Box Stores turn criminal and align themselves with Anti-Vaxxers to wreak havoc? It’s your turn…

Fans, the wait is over! This new twist on a classic design makes possible a video-game version of this long-unavailable treasure from Steve Jackson Games. 150 cards in core game, including 6 Illuminati—now every backer gets duplicates of the 150 cards, all the better to stack the deck with. 

Socially-distanced fun for 1-6 players, avg. playtime around 45 minutes. Best on desktops and tablets. Steam. Apple. Google Play. 

Sample Card Art for Men in Black, Conspiracy Theorists, Social Media, and the Music Industry.
Why we need your support
This is a passion-project based on an award-winning game with a deep fan base. 
Illuminati: New World Order sold 60+ million cards, though card prices ($1,000 or more for a complete set!) keep it out of the hands of modern players. 
People have wanted this video game for years! 
Derek Pearcy, who in 1994 helped produce Illuminati: New World Order for Steve Jackson Games, long wondered how to adapt Illuminati as a satisfying video game—too often, table-top adaptations aren’t that much fun. He finally dreamed up a solution, and with Steve Jackson’s advice and blessing, the project was born.
Project includes video game development; 150+ cards with art for the core game; 3 seasons of now 40-cards each, introducing new themes, cards, plot twists; and localization (see below).
Game-play in a nutshell
It’s simple once you’re playing. Players take the role of an Illuminati—a secret, global conspiracy—each with a different personality and strategy that works for them‚ and against their opponents. For example, the Cthulhu player wins by destroying things, the Gnomes of Zurich by amassing money, and Bavaria grows by collecting raw power, and so on. You’re dealt a card at the beginning of each turn, and then try attack and conquer cards—the deck’s or other people’s—to fill your power-structure pyramid.
To make the game more interesting, Plot cards allow players to reinforce themselves as well as mess with each other. Plot cards can:
weaken opponents
strengthen your cards or weaken your enemies’
change any card's alignments—turn the peaceful Boy Sprouts into violent killers
and otherwise cause mayhem and make your opponents cry.
Along the road to world domination, the unexpected consequences are hilarious. Maybe you'll have the CIA attack the Cycle Gangs. How? Uhh…through the Convenience Stores! With support from…a Swiss Bank Account? In your next turn, the Big-Box Stores become criminal and align themselves with Anti-Vaxxers to wreak havoc! As the night goes on, you’ll see the current world order go sideways. The new world might match your hopes, or your fears.
First one to build their pyramid wins—and the winner collects a card they can use in a future game.
Your Illuminati can share its vast power with its puppets, helping grow the conspiracy.
In Party Mode, everyone draws from the same deck, guaranteed to be well-balanced for whichever Illuminati are in the game. It’s a good way to enter this world and start collecting cards.
In Stacked-Deck Mode, people can bring a set of 12 cards of choice to the table. (If anyone know how to stack a deck, it’s the Illuminati.) You can buy Starter Packs, crafted to suit each Illuminati's strengths, or build them yourself from cards you’ll collect after winning games.
Social aspect of Illuminati Confirmed: A newsfeed down one side of the screen lets the players have free and frank exchanges of view, almost like a social network for the New World Order. The newsfeed is live, but uses a menu of pre-made responses—to avoid randos creating a bad vibe.
Difficulty rating: Satisfyingly rich, but not that hard. Includes edgy and nuanced political humor that kids younger than 14 might not be ready for.
Game duration: around 45 minutes.

How to Build Your Conspiracy & Take Over the World
Every group card is rated by its Power and Resistance as a number from 0 to 5. Subtract the target’s resistance from the attacker’s Power, and that will tell you how likely the attacker can wrestle control over its target.
The most unusual and important game mechanic in the game—and most crucial to giving an attacker leverage when a target puts up a fight—are Alignments. There are four pairs of opposing alignments, and two special ones. Here’s how they work: every matching alignment that attacker and target have in common reduces the target’s Resistance by 2 points, while every opposing alignment boosts the target’s Resistance by 2. 
For example, the Flat Earthers are Weird and Conservative…
…while the Semiconscious Liberation Army is Criminal, Violent, Liberal, and Weird! 
Attributes & Special Abilities
It is rare for cards to have more than two alignments. See Marketing Execs, for example.
What she does have is an Attribute, shown by the broadcasting tower on the right side—that means we’re looking at a Media group. 
While the game doesn’t mess with attributes like it does with alignments, they can be just as crucial to success. Several Plot cards can only be powered by a Media group—like Scandal or Miracle Diet Plan—or will only work on a Media group—like Pulitzer Prize and Censorship. 
Some groups are Places—like Germany, Silicon Valley, or Stonehenge—which have special attributes of their own: Coastal, Huge, and Nation. Soon you'll see Disaster cards, special Plots to damage Places. Some disasters, like Tidal Wave, only work on Coastal places, while some disasters, like Meteor Strike, are less effective against Huge places. A Huge place like China can shrug off a single meteor falling from the sky, though the same threat may worry the Pentagon.

THE PLAN
We are racing toward a functional prototype! We’ve recently accelerated our plans, offering Early Access to higher-tier backers from February through April, with a full launch in August. If we meet our Kickstarter goal, we will begin releasing the three seasons in October 2021. Each season will feature at least 20 cards, each bound by a common theme. Here are the seasons we commit to delivering as part of our basic funding plan:

Season 1: Assassins!—Bringing individual people into the game as controllable cards, and (mostly) bad things to do them
Season 2: Ancient Secrets—Magic comes to the world of Illuminati
Season 3: Weird Science—Gadgets, gizmos and the shadowy figures who use them

Wait—Will There Be More?
It should shock no one that we are planning for more than three seasons, taking players through a well-rounded story with wicked twists and turns. Check back in through late-December for updates.

Platforms
We’re committed to making Illuminati Confirmed available for desktop and tablets through Steam, as well as on Google Play and the Apple App Store.
Localization
We are working with several companies to get Illuminati Confirmed properly localized. Most people think about that as “translation,” though that sells short the hard work these professionals perform. Our development lead, Derek Pearcy, spent a decade designing localization support into many complex, widely used user interfaces. Our game will support multiple languages from day one with little to no extra development effort.
Because Illuminati has always been extremely popular in Germany and France, those two are first on the list. We’re considering Spanish (with different localization for Spain, Mexico, and South America), as well as Portuguese, Japanese, Italian, Polish, Russian, and Simplified Chinese. We can tell you more once the Kickstarter is over, but we will make decisions based on demand, so be sure to let us hear your voices.

THE ILLUMINATI STORY  
The first version of Illuminati, on half-sized cards in 1982.
In 1982, Steve Jackson published the original Illuminati card game. It was both darkly serious as well as funny, a satire reflecting conspiracy theories and pop-culture at the time. In 1994, Illuminati: New World Order was released as an early Collectible Card Game with nearly four times as many cards as any previous version of the game, updated with color art and then-modern conspiracy thinking. As a game, it was also fiercely rich and complex. 
Conspiracy theorists claim that the 1990s version of the game made uncanny predictions about the future. Will Illuminati Confirmed expose clues to upcoming global struggles? Pledge to find out. For more background on that, check out the Deep Cuts Podcast featuring interviews with Steve Jackson and Derek Pearcy.
BACKER TIERS
We are offering a variety of tiers, including the basic game, additional seasons, starter packs and even lifetime subscriptions to any and all future digital content we release for Illuminati Confirmed. Some items like special Illuminati tile-markers (bronze, silver, gold, as well as the ultra-rare green, glowing neutonium) and the INWO deck will only ever be available through this Kickstarter. See notes at the bottom for details on some of the special rewards.
 We’re giving every player 2 copies of each card—300 cards!
 We’re now doubling the number of cards per season, giving this tier 340 cards!
 After doubling the number of cards per season, this 3-season tier has 420 cards! 
New! This tier now comes with a playable adaptation of 1994’s award-winning Illuminati: New World Order—at least 300 faithfully adapted cards for a total of 720 cards! 
Each starter deck provides a set of at least 12 cards, each set designed to help an Illuminati shine. Every deck duplicates cards already available in the game, though having duplicates of cards which specifically help you is a good thing. Six decks means 72 more cards for a total of 792 cards.
Lastly, your triangular Illuminati tile will have a bronze border around it, showing everyone your greatness as a Kickstarter campaign backer.
We plan to stand up our online services in stages, on-boarding more and more people over time. Even more importantly, we want feedback on the earliest stable versions of the local multiplayer game. Since it’s hard to pick who gets to go first, we thought we’d let people pay to get in line, beginning with this tier. The order of access will be:
Eternally Illuminated + Game with SJ & DP
YOU ARE ILLUMINATED

Esoteric Order of Early Access
We expect to begin seeding backers with local multi-player versions of the game—using original cards and art from the 1990s edition—in March, then on-boarding early backers to our online service no later than June 2021. Players in each group above will gain access to the game in the order they backed the project, from earlier to later.
Also, your triangular Illuminati tile will have a silver border around it, showing everyone how fantastic you are as a Kickstarter campaign backer.
As long as we put out digital ILCO content, you’ll get it. That includes everything, even limited-time card releases. Pretty straightforward. You’ll get 1 or 4 digital keycodes granting your account access to the content you’re owed.
Also, your triangular Illuminati tile will have a GOLD border around it, because you're amazing and the other global conspiracies you're playing against should cower before you.
Tucked away in a box for 26 years, Derek’s had a shrink-wrapped Point-of-Purchase display containing 6 pairs of shrink-wrapped Limited Edition INWO decks from among some of the very first cards to show up at the SJ Games offices. You and a friend can bust them open and play just like they did in 1994. 
As shown in the list above, 2 lucky people will be the first players onboarded once we’re ready to test the game and its online services—andd Steve and Derek will play against you. They’ll probably be too busy sinking each other, so you may actually have a chance of winning. We can work with you to schedule a time mutually available to both backers, though it will be bounded by Steve Jackson’s Central Time Zone, between sunrise and early evening.
As long as we put out digital ILCO content, you’ll get it—but you'll get 4 digital keycodes granting access to all that content. Split it with 3 friends for less than any of you could become Eternally Illuminated on your own, or bring a ho-ho-whole lot of diabolical joy to 3 friends you look forward to trouncing in the battle for world domination. 
What it says: all the cards available in the original, 1994 retail release of Illuminati: New World Order. Derek has two: one set in individual sleeves and the other in a binder. Pick which one you’d prefer—he’s only parting with one of them.
Everyone knows what Neutonium is, so we won’t insult anyone’s intelligence by talking about it here. But—do you want to be an agent on the F.B.I. card? Or a guy in a suit getting dragged away in handcuffs on the Wall Street card? We will work with you to get your likeness on something that works for you. It will on everyone’s version of that card, so let’s make it count.

If you have any questions, please ask and we’ll happily update these details.

FUNDING GOAL
In the past year, we’ve had the opportunity to get feedback from fans, and people are thrilled about what we want to do. Still, it’s a significant investment of time and money. We’re launching this Kickstarter to raise the funds to finish the new art, complete the game development, and build the online services needed to support a modern game-play experience.
We can make Illuminati Confirmed, including the core game and three seasons, if we hit our goal of $210,000. We will update the graphic below as we hit major milestones to show our progress as we move through the Kickstarter.
Progress toward our goal…not so much so far, but we just launched. When the eye opens, consider the game confirmed.

updates.update_content:
Thanks for your patience, everyone. We are back. 
In two weeks—April 21—you can again join the conspiracy bringing Steve Jackson’s classic, turn-based strategy game to life as a video game.
Expect lower backer levels, a more modest goal, and a streamlined campaign to help sell your friends on the project, plus images of the game in its current state of development. This is really happening.

Today brings an important campaign update. And we reveal a new Plot card for backers only!
When we planned this campaign, it was with a passion to introduce even more players to Steve Jackson’s Illuminati in its various forms. As you can tell, I love this game.
For now we’re closing this campaign and taking a holiday break. Our goal is to restart in late January, 2021. Look for an update in the next week with a link to follow the relaunch.

Leeman Kessler of “Ask Lovecraft” was kind enough to invite me onto one of his “After Dark” segments, where he sat me down for an interview about both my time at Steve Jackson Games and our shared love for Illuminati: New World Order, along with some details about Illuminati Confirmed that I'm happy to share for the first time. It was a great conversation about how and why the game has resonated for us both over so many years—and why people who’ve never played the game should really take a look at Illuminati Confirmed, especially given the times we live in.

New Card Preview Wednesday
If you’ve visited the campaign page since this afternoon, Pacific time, then you likely saw the updated Kickstarter splash image that Solario finished today, which highlights some more of the new card art we’ve already made for Illuminati Confirmed.
(If new cards get you only so excited, scroll down to the bottom for updates on a few other subjects.)

Illuminated News
We are right at the edge of 30%—and about 30% into the campaign. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive to how we moved things around in our plan, though honestly who doesn't want more sooner. Don't say we don’t listen to reasonable requests. Check out the backer page to see how we updated things there.

Illuminati is one of those things that's hard to explain to people who haven't played it. When we planned this campaign, beyond wanting to expose more people to the game, we wanted to create something with legs, something we could do well and feel good about looking back—something people would like, and hopefully they'd think has value.
The first week of our Kickstarter confirmed for us a couple of things: there's still a ton of people out there who love the game, and there's more than enough room for a modernized version of Illuminati in its most sophisticated form, that being the 1994 edition called .

FAQ Friday

Changing Pledge & Keeping Limited-time Cards

campaign.story:
A Conspiracy of Ravens
It has been a miserably, long day and all you want to do is lay your head on your pillow and slip away into a sweet slumber.
Bong... Bong... Bong
The bells of the church wake you suddenly in the middle of the night. A thick, red hued fog has surrounded your home of Meadhan. Almost everyone in the entire village has disappeared and shadowy figures dart in and out of the corners of your vision. You leave the safety of your home with pitchforks, cleavers, and shovels ready to face the evils of the night. Something wicked has come to Meadhan!!
A conspiracy of ravens attacks a poor, helpless girl. Save her!
A Conspiracy of Ravens is a horror themed adventure module that can be played as a 0-level funnel or as a 1st level adventure that uses  Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG . A "funnel" is a game in which players will play 2 to 4 everyday townsfolk who begin at 0-level with no special abilities or skills. Players use cunning, tactical retreat, and brute force through strength of numbers to overcome perilous situations and bloodthirsty monsters to save the day. The very few, lucky peasants who survive become emboldened with new abilities as 1st level characters and embark on glorious, treasure filled quests with a new found spirit of adventure.
The "funnel" game is synonymous with Dungeon Crawl Classics tabletop gaming. It is an excellent way to introduce completely new players to role playing and a very fun way to keep veteran players on their toes. A Conspiracy of Ravens takes classic aspects of horror that you love and reimagines them in a frightening new light... or darkness.
Lost children in need of being saved... or are they?
A suspicious old lady... she could be a benefit or curse to the party.
Man's best friend... think Cujo but much, much more gruesome.
Possession... who doesn't love someone who can spin their head 360°
A sacrificial finale that puts the Salem witch trials to shame... and much more!
A Conspiracy of Ravens is non setting specific and can be easily adapted into any fantasy world. The module has gone through many playtests during online conventions like Founders and Legends III and Bride of Cyclops Con and has been thoroughly worked over by various home groups. 
The current page count of the finished module is 24 pages, but with stretch goals that would be increased to an anticipated 28 or 32 pages. Interior pages will be 60# offset with black ink and a 12pt C1S (coated 1 side) color cover. Module dimensions will be 8.5" X 11".
Tomlin, Meadhan's Dwarven Blacksmith, but not quite how you remember him.
What's New?
 With this module I wanted to bring something new to the table, a new idea on how adventures can be played. Everyone knows that is a very bad idea to split the party, almost always ending in misfortune, death, or a TPK (total party kill). In A Conspiracy of Ravens and subsequent modules to follow, one signature element will be situations in which the party is forced to choose whether or not to split up, or has no choice at all in being taken down different paths. For this particular DCC horror adventure the party begins the module split into different groups and must navigate a deceiving encounter to come together as one. But that is only part of what is inside.
The entire module is completely packed with new, original art by some amazing artists
New tables
New monsters
A table with new mercurial magic effects including my personal favorite:
You Are a Hero! For the next 1d7 days, the caster acts only for the benefit of others, accepting hopeless quests, saving the innocent, defending the helpless, donating all worldly possessions, and acting completely selflessly -in the exact opposite of DCC fashion
The hint of a new Patron coming soon in ensuing modules
Beautiful, hand-drawn, original maps returning you to the old school feeling of playing in the basement with friends
A devious, new trap that could result in a TPK by itself
And of course a new spell - Emirikol’s Sacrificial Assistance!
Will you prevent the Ravens from summoning the 14th King of Hell, Mistolresanees?
Pledge Tiers
$2 - The Beetle: For this tier you will receive all the emails on the progression and status of the project and my gratitude.
$7 - The Raven: A PDF copy of A Conspiracy of Ravens, all unlocked digital stretch goals, be listed as a backer in the module, and my unceasing gratitude. 
$13 - The Homunculus: A PDF copy of A Conspiracy of Ravens, a softcover print copy shipped to your door, be listed as a backer in the module, all unlocked stretch goals, and my perpetual thanks.
$18 - The Imp: A PDF copy of A Conspiracy of Ravens, a softcover print copy shipped to your door with the Kickstarter exclusive foil cover, be listed as a backer in the module, all unlocked stretch goals, and my undying appreciation and adoration. The exclusive KS foil cover will never again be reprinted as long as I own the rights to the module, which I anticipate will be forever.

Stretch Goals
 FULLY FUNDED !! 
 $2000 - Fully Funded! You deserve a reward simply for helping us meet our goal and your support of bringing the dreams of creators like myself to life. 25 backers will receive an autographed copy of A Conspiracy of Ravens with my signature and a message of thanks. Imagine if you could go back in time to get an autographed copy of one of Gygax's first module! Now I am not saying that I will ever be that legendary, but every once in a while dreams do come true.
Note: Autographed copy will be substituted for unsigned copy. The 25 backers will still only receive (1) one book per pledge level.
Unlocked!
 $3000 - More Art! As you can see by the original art that is shown in this campaign, the module is already full of excellent art. This goal will allow the commission of more pieces to completely stuff the module with astounding visuals and ensure that the artists are rewarded with a bonus for their time, effort, and passion.
Unlocked!
 $4000 - Upgrade to Printing! Interior paper will be increased to 80lb text uncoated and exterior cover will be increased to 14pt C1S.
 $5000 - More Maps! Personally, I love maps. With this goal 3 additional bonus maps will be included in the pdf and module. All will be drawn by hand and touched up digitally. Bonus maps are:
1. Area map including the surrounding world around Meadhan, for further    adventure expansion in a homebrew campaign. This map will also coincide with future titles.
2. Map of the interior of the mayor of Meadhan's estate, including the trap that could result in a TPK .
3. Map of the interior of Speedling House for Boys. A creepy orphanage that hides a disturbing, new monster, the Humsier.
The Humsier!
 $6000 - More Content! New mini-settings will be created for both Mayor Wenchell's Estate and the Speedling House for Boys. Both settings currently have only 1 encounter based on the time it would take to play the module. With this goal I will create both mini-settings with full descriptions of all of the rooms, including multiple encounters in each setting to coincide with the maps. This will add an optional 1-2 hours of gameplay per area, depending on your players.
Note: This reward will be delivered at a later date as a PDF, not included with the delivery of the original pledge levels or in print form.
 $7000 - More for the Players! It isn't just about the Judges, with this goal the print module will come with a full set of illustrated handouts to give to the players during play.
 $8000 - Custom Character Sheet! Custom 0-level character sheets will be commissioned so your players will be able to brag about having the coolest PC sheet around.
Note: This reward will be delivered at a later date as a PDF AND a pack will be mailed to you in physical form. When we are able to come out of our houses again, you will be ready.
 $9000 - Art Print! Backers who back at the Homunculus and Imp physical print levels will receive (1) one limited edition 8.5" x 11" art print of one of the original art pieces from the module. These selections will be randomly selected and shipped with the module.
 10,000 - ?????

 The Artists
Some amazing artists have signed on to illustrate this module, let me introduce you to:
 Melanie (Florencio) Sexton is a multimedia artist who has done comic work for both pleasure and corporate. Her credits include Alterna Comics' "The Curse of Stranglehold", "Undead Norm: A Zombie Comedy" webseries, as well as corporate training comics for the US Military and Blackboard.  Melanie Florencio Sexton 
 Davin Kluttz is a professional illustrator and designer from Bend, Oregon where he founded the local “Bend DnD” RPG meetup group. He creates content for D&D, DCC RPG, and Shadowrun, including cartography, creatures, and old school illustrations. He fell in love with DCC RPG in 2018 and has since collaborated on DCC zines, such as Gongfarmer’s Almanac and Quarazine.  As a game master, has run countless adventures and regularly attends game conventions on the road from his van, which sports a mobile game table! Follow him on Instagram.  Davin Kluttz 
 Cheese Hasselberger has been drawing and publishing underground/indie comics for 20+ years. During that time he’s released numerous anthology collections, solo comics and even a RPG game module. You can see more of his art on his Instagram.  Cheese Hasselberger  
 L.F. OSR Inspired by early roleplaying game supplements, L.F. OSR aims to create original artwork that harkens back to art styles featured in those older materials while incorporating a unique twist on the traditional format. Give him a follow at   L.F. OSR 
 Steve Stegelin is the long-running award-winning cartoonist at the alt-weekly Charleston City Paper in Charleston, SC. He's also known for his indie hangout comic Boondoggle, has previously published at Knight Press, Caliber Comics, and PopImage. For more of his illustrations, check out his portfolio at  Steve Stegelin , or follow him on Twitter and Instagram at Steve Stegelin Instagram 
Unlocked with $3000 stretch goal!
 Johnathan (John) Bingham is a New Zealand based artist, illustrator, game designer, cyber security professional, father, husband and moonshiner. He has contributed to many Old School Gaming publications to include Adventurer, Conqueror, King; Astonishing Swordsmen and Sorcerers of Hyperborea;  Expeditious Retreat Press Advanced Adventures line and the Halls of Arden Vul; and many more.  You can view his portfolio at:  Jonathan Bingham 
 Terry Pavlet is an award winning freelance artist from Wisconsin who has over 20 years experience illustrating and graphic designing. His clientele include DC, Image, Malibu, Dark Horse, Wizards of the Coast, Disney, Milennium, and many more. You can see his work at   Terry Pavlet Facebook  and  Haus of Design 

You don't want to end up like this guy. Back the Kickstarter today!
Tell me more about Dungeon Crawl Classics
 Dungeon Crawl Classics is a d20 tabletop role-playing game published by Goodman Games. Heavily influenced by Gary Gygax's  Appendix N, Goodman Games has modernized the rules but remained true to the ideals of old school sword and sorcery games. Fast paced gameplay, unpredictable magics, 0-level funnel adventures, and a little bit of Luck are just some of the hallmarks that put DCC RPG above other games. These qualities make it a fun, imaginative, and memorable adventure ending with your character perishing in horribly, epic ways or living in glory upon piles of treasure! You can get a free quick start copy of the rules and a free introductory module at  Goodman Games Quick Start Rules.

campaign.story:
A Packet of What?
A Packet of Particular Peaks. This is a go-to reference for a system neutral, old school inspired fantasy setting that aims to provide a “drop-in-and-drop-out” experience. You can run a small side quest within the peaks, provide a parallel campaign to your normal adventures, or simply pull from this packet for game-able material in your role playing game sessions.
Contained in this packet you’ll find three particular peaks featuring dream-like locations, strange inhabitants, unique overland features, an extensive bestiary, and much more.
We hope you enjoy your time in the peaks!
Digital mockup of cover
The Three Peaks
Passage Peak, Dream Peak, and Bleak Peak are three particular peaks that all feature unique aspects and deep mysteries for players to explore. Each peak can be thought of as an individual world (or setting), all with specific methods used to enter a given peak. None of these particular peaks are accessible via physical travel, as each peak represents a mental state that only exists within a character's mind. Experiences will vary greatly between each of them, with memories (or nightmares) waiting to be made; and adventures to be had. 
 Passage Peak - A deceptively tranquil mountain range filled with stunning meadows, planes, and forests. Passage Peak represents a metaphorical "happy place" for some, and a literal feeding frenzy for those that seek to benefit from the positive energy generated in this breathtaking realm.
 Dream Peak - Unbelievable beauty weaves throughout Dream Peak, as if perfection was a flowing river that washes over the rolling hills caught between awe-inducing snow capped mountains. However, the wondrous structures, majestic beasts, and incredible views cannot hide the insidious events that occur within Dream Peak. 
 Bleak Peak - Extremely dangerous, deprived of color, and full of threats. Bleak Peak represents turmoil, and it's terrain reflects that as it bends and sharpens with every minute; convulsing as if it were mutating in front of the viewer's eyes. Home to sinister factions, unspeakable monstrosities, and insanity inducing spectral beings. 
The Full Contents
A Packet of Particular Peaks is an art-heavy setting source book intended to be used for fantasy tabletop role playing games. It can be used with nearly any pre-existing system, and does not include system specific stats, rules, or restrictions. 
Both digital and physical copies will include:
Detailed descriptions of 3 unique mountain settings
Outlined methods of entering each peak
Highlighted inhabitants, random events, overland features, and locations of interest for each of the peaks
Bestiary of 18 illustrated creatures
3 hex maps - one for each peak!
d100 magic items. That's right, one-hundred!
A handy adventure prompt generator
32+ original illustrations by L.F. OSR 
12+ additional information tables
Digital mockup of interior pages
Specifications
Although these specifications are subject to change based on the total amount of funds raised, the current specifications are as follows:
5.5" x 8.5" perfect bound softcover book
Thick natural felt weave cover (with inside cover printing)
Natural uncoated interior pages
Black and white printing using premium inks
75+ total pages
The Deluxe Tier
Alongside our Digital and Physical reward tiers, we will also be offering the Deluxe Tier limited to 50 special backers that wish to experience all that the peaks have to offer. Backers of at the Deluxe Tier will receive:
Physical copy of A Packet of Particular Peaks
Digital (.PDF) copy of A Packet of Particular Peaks
Your name printed in the interior front cover of the book
A postcard featuring bespoke artwork on one side, with a handwritten message from one of the inhabitants of the Peaks on the other
High quality "I Visited the Peaks" decal-style sticker
A one-page dungeon trifold (physical & digital .PDF copies included)
A unique, cut to shape bookmark
Exclusive 8" x 8" print, signed and numbered by L.F. OSR 
Free "A Glance at the Peaks" Digital Trifold
Now available, A Glance At The Peaks is a trifold featuring some details about the peaks, a couple of beasts that you might find there, a one-page dungeon, and the official "A Packet of Particular Peaks Theme Song" composed by fantasy synthesizer composer Quest Master!
Click here to download A Glance at the Peaks

It's an honor to work with Quest Master to help bring the sounds of the peaks to life. You can find more of Quest Master's music on Bandcamp or on Instagram.
What is L.F. OSR?
L.F. OSR originally started as an art project inspired by early role playing game supplements, aiming to create original artwork that hearkens back to art styles featured in those older materials, while incorporating a unique twist on the traditional format. Aside from creating original artwork for fantasy worlds, L.F. OSR has recently started a new journey designing game-able content for role playing games, producing original supplements, and supporting the OSR community.
 L.F. OSR on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lf_osr/ 
 L.F. OSR on Twitter: https://twitter.com/lf_osr 
 L.F. OSR Website: https://lfosr.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since this is our first Kickstarter campaign, we've intentionally kept the reward tiers simple and decided not to offer any stretch goals or additional add-ons that would complicate production or shipping. Outside of our control, we still face a small amount of uncertainty due to potential delays caused by the current COVID-19 pandemic. Both our team and our printer teams' top priority is safety first and foremost which helps to avoid delays on the production side of things. Many stages required before printing can begin are nearly completed as of now in order to help us get a head start on fulfillment, and to make up for potential delays while still aiming to meet our intended deadline.

campaign.story:
The newest edition of the Deadlands: The Weird West roleplaying game (at the printer and shipping early 2021!) focuses on Wild Western tales of local horror, and what could be better than a good old-fashioned cattle drive from Hell!
This twisted tale takes a posse of hard-riding drovers and their Texas Longhorns from the rolling hills of Texas through swollen streams in Colorado, the mountain passes of New Mexico, the haunted prairies of Wyoming, and more! The weirdness escalates along the way, slowly exposing our heroes to the true horrors of the Weird West. So saddle up, partners, and join us on a Blood Drive!
Includes PDFs and VTT assets for the Blood Drive Campaign, Figure Flats, Archetype Set 3, Infernal Device cards, AND Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass!). See below for more details!
Includes the PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book and TWELVE new PRINTED Archetype Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of the book, Figure Flats, Archetype and Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, and SIX Infernal Device Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything, including Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard Pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, SIX Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything.
Here's a closer look at the rewards, amigos!
Blood Drive is a 96-page hardcover book printed in full color.
The Blood Drive Campaign Book
This gorgeous, graphic-novel size hardback contains all you need to run this epic tale of intrigue, adventure, and exploration. The story takes our heroes from greenhorn cowpunchers to hardened trail hands, letting players take on the roles of regular cowboys and cowgirls or any mix of Deadlands' unique character types.
Interior spreads from the book, already laid out and ready for printing! Your support helps us create the additional materials we think will add to the entire Deadlands experience!
Archetype Cards
Our Archetype Cards allow players to jump into Blood Drive or any other Deadlands game quickly. We gave you a passel of pregenerated characters in the original Deadlands Kickstarter, and Set 3 adds even more ready-to-play heroes and heroines to choose from!
Print Version: 127x89mm on sturdy and durable 350gsm cardstock.
12 new Archetype Cards suitable for Blood Drive or your own Deadlands games. Stay tuned for updates and previews as the Kickstarter drives on!
Pawns
This project features three sheets of Deadlands Pawns containing a selection of characters and critters and brand new terrain pieces as well! (We'll have art to show you soon, partners!)
We'll supplement your maps with campfires, a chuck wagon, hangin' trees, and other bits you'll find useful for Blood Drive or your own outdoor adventures, all printed on thick, die-cut punchboard. 
Beautifully illustrated front and back and easy to transport, Deadlands Pawns make your games come to life on the tabletop, especially when used with our gorgeous new map packs (see below)!
Sample pawns from our first pawn set. We'll have new art to show soon for these Blood Drive-specific pawns.
Infernal Device Cards
Mad Scientists in the Weird West harness the Hellish energy of the superfuel known as ghost rock to power their incredible gizmos. These quick reference cards grant convenient access to the most important information about six common infernal gadgets, adding to those already printed in the original boxed set.
Print Version: 2.5" x 3.5" on 300gsm cardstock.
Map Packs
Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns. They're marked with a  light one inch grid, perfect for Savage Worlds. Map Pack 3: End of the Line features a train station, corner saloon, and other classic western buildings. Map Pack 4: Ambush Pass features wilderness terrain ideal for use in Blood Drive. We'll have detailed images for you soon!
Print Version: 30" x 24", double-sided, laminated cardstock for use with dry and wet-erase pens.
Artist's render of a Deadlands pawn on Map Pack 1 (Grand Saloon).
Our Kickstarter Boosters are smaller support projects for our existing lines. They come with Booster Rewards built-in rather than Stretch Goals. We're definitely going to print them on our own no matter what and want you to know that up front, but are asking for your backing so we can order the right amount and most importantly, create the extras that add to the entire experience for all of us—like maps, pawns, and additional Archetype Cards. We play too, and we want all these goodies as much as we hope you do!
Why Kickstarter?
Pinnacle is very fortunate and grateful to have a loyal and established group of friends and fans who enjoy playing our games, but it's sometimes very hard to get our products to you. We love game stores and sell to them through our fulfillment partners at Studio2 and through traditional distribution, but we also know many of you don't have a store in your neighborhood, or your local store just doesn't carry our games.
For those that do, great! Retailers who want in on our Kickstarters get discounted versions of the rewards including Stretch Goals for them and their customers. If you're a retailer, just sign up to our newsletter for all the details. (And gamers, please feel free to let your local store know!) Retailers also get their rewards when backer orders go out, usually several weeks before they show up in the traditional distribution chain.
In sum...
If you want Blood Drive and the extras we're offering with it, back this Kickstarter Booster.
If you want Blood Drive but prefer to support your local store, GREAT! You can pledge for the Digital reward level here if you like, get the Booster Rewards, then order the print version of the book from your store later next year. (But be sure to tell them or they might not order it on their own!)
Deadlands is the premier Weird Western setting. You can download the free Test Drive, here to see what it's all about.
If you missed the Deadlands: the Weird West Kickstarter, you can still get in on the action through the pledge manager, which is still open. Anything you add through that pledge manager will be delivered as soon as it arrives in our warehouse in early 2021.
You'll be able to add these items to your Blood Drive order in the Pledge Manager.
You can also add on our other Deadlands products once we launch the Blood Drive pledge manager (available sometime after this Kickstarter Booster closes and funds). There you'll be able to add on extras like the Deadlands core boxed set, pawns, the Horror at Headstone Hill campaign, town maps, Action Cards, Bennies, and more!
Spread the word!
It's hard for a small company like ours to get the word out about our game and our worlds. If you care to help boost the signal, you can do so using the following channels. Much obliged, amigo!
Blood Drive is written and in layout. Your support allows us to create the extras and get the word out to other fans (by far the hardest challenge for a small company like ours).
We plan to deliver the PDF of the book and cards a few weeks after the project funds and we get the final backer list from Kickstarter.  This means delivery of the main PDFs about a month after funding and the physical products about 5 months later depending on the printer and shipping, and barring unforeseen mishaps...y'know, like world-wide pandemics and all!
Digital Rewards
We deliver PDF materials through the Pinnacle website  first, then through DriveThruRPG.com.
Physical Rewards
After the Kickstarter ends we'll use a pledge manager to collate the physical pledges and allow you the opportunity to include additional Pinnacle products with your pledge. 
We'll charge for shipping after the Kickstarter through the pledge manager, but below is a table estimating how much the shipping will be. It's possible these prices may go down as we continue to seek out different options, but we won't charge you any more than what's listed below.
*Prices exclusive of VAT/GST, shown in USD. We will collect and pay customs in the pledge manager. USA backers pay no additional shipping on Add Ons!
Customs and Taxes for EU, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand
We know international shipping is an expensive part of buying games and we're constantly looking for ways to reduce those costs.
The above rates are postage only. Depending on your location, additional VAT/GST will be added to your order in the pledge manager. For example, current VAT for books in the UK is 0%, while Denmark is 25%. After collecting these fees in the pledge manager, our regional partners pay the taxes and file paperwork for you during shipping!
To save on international shipping, consider having one of your friends pledge for your whole posse, then "Add-On" additional books to a single package. You should also encourage your local retailer to sign up as a Savage Retailer so they can order directly from us (before it hits regular distribution). Then you can buy the physical product from your favorite local game store, while you pledge at a digital reward level so you don't miss out on the digital Stretch Goals.
We Ship Anywhere in the World
Email Info@peginc.com for an estimate to ship to your location if you don't see it above.  You can also use the handy calculator at USPS.com (most rewards ship in a 12x12x12 inch box, but the Book Only tier will likely ship in a padded envelope).
Delivery for Merchants
Read our "Welcome, Retailer!" Newsletter here for the basics we recommend for your store!
All retailers located in the contiguous United States receive free shipping. Retailers in Hawaii, Alaska, and outside the United States receive discounted shipping. The store also receives Kickstarter products before retail release and may restock other Pinnacle products with their order. We recommend retailers sign up for our Savage Retailer newsletter here (no pledge required at this time). Customers of Savage Retailers may request complimentary PDFs of books purchased by emailing Info@peginc.com.
Any Questions? Email Pinnacle customer service at Info@peginc.com

campaign.story:
Digest-sized so it sits pretty on your shelf or right in your game bag.
The Megazine You Didn’t Know You Needed!
Since the premiere issue was a big hit, we’re back with SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2! Now with 100% newer gaming content that you can drop right into your post-apocalyptic, sci-fi, or fantasy genre-mash role playing game. 9 out of 10 wasteland warriors agree, you don’t want to go into an ancient science installation without one.
What’s a Megazine?
Bigger and better than a fanzine, not quite as fancy as a magazine, SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2 is a megazine. It’s 6” x 9” in size, with 64+ pages of pro gaming content created and produced by industry veterans. This megazine is also perfect-bound with a spine, so they stand up nicely on a shelf as you collect them! The megazine concept is an exciting new format we here at Mudpuppy Games are proud to pioneer, and we can’t wait to see how many others adopt what we think is a pretty nifty format for jamming a gaming publication straight on your shelf, or into game bag or backpack.
Here are just a few of the apocalyptic delights awaiting you in SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2.
Manifest of Wonders
We are extremely proud of the creative team we gathered for issue No.1, and now they are all back for SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2 — plus a few exciting additions! We’ve got a mini-adventure by James M. Spahn (The Hero’s Journey, The One Ring, Star Wars), fiction by James M. Ward (Metamorphosis Alpha, Gamma World, 77 Lost Worlds), and more great stuff from Levi Combs (Planet X Games), Skeeter Green (Skeeter Green Productions), Tim Kask, Travis Hanson, and Jolly Blackburn. Check out the Table of Contents below!
Contents subject to change prior to publication, because sometimes we have great ideas later.
Not Just For the Radioactive at Heart
Sure, all this great new gaming material has been designed with the discriminating post-apocalyptic gamer in mind, but it is also eminently suitable for fantasy games — especially if your campaign needs a fresh jolt of excitement. In both the pulp literature that inspired our hobby and in the fantasy games of yore, many a magic item or monster turned out to have scientific origins. The contents of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN are ideal for getting seen-it-all done-it-all fantasy players back on their toes and engaged with new surprises. All material presented is useable with any d20-based game system.
BACKER-ONLY EXCLUSIVE
Need a new monster or treasure for tonight's game? It's digitally indexed right here.
The CRYPTIC CONCORDANCE is a backer-only exclusive not available to the general public. It contains an art-filled index of every mutant, monster, machine, or malevolent magic that has appeared in issues No.1 and No.2 of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN, plus any of the same that appeared in our books Check This Artifact and Fight This Mutant. Each entry is cross-referenced by book and page number, just to make a GM’s life that much easier when it’s time to add a new creature, class, spell, or artifact to your post-apocalyptic or genre-mashed fantasy game.
 The Perfect Holiday Gift!
Holiday gift giving like it was 1977! Print this digital certificate out, put it in a box, then wrap it up.
Want to get a copy of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.2 as a gift for someone else, but you're concerned that the megazine won't be released until March 2021? We have a plan! Directly after this projects funds, all backers will receive a digital Early Bird Gift Certificate that you can print out and give them right on the holiday.
How to Pledge for Multiple Copies
Need to pledge for multiple copies of SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #2? Just select the pledge level for the PRINT + PDF and fill out the dollar amount in multiples of $15 (i.e., $30 for two copies, $45 for three copies, etc).
Retailer Pledge Level
Especially in these times, we support all of our brick-and-mortar game stores. If you are a retailer and wish to pledge at the Retailer Pledge Level, all we ask is that you send us verification via email or messages after pledging.
Shipping Costs
Each book will be shipped to backers via USPS in a sturdy cardboard envelope. Per Kickstarter recommendations, shipping and handling costs ARE NOT INCLUDED IN THE PLEDGE LEVELS. Shipping and handling is an economical $5 per book shipped. Add-On books ship at an extra $2 each. Retailer shipping will be via Media Mail and is also only $5.
ALL SHIPPING FOR PRINT BOOKS IS TO THE USA ONLY, so please pledge accordingly. Current International shipping costs are so high that shipping outside the USA is not feasible for Mudpuppy Games at this time. We know that sucks, but much larger companies with better resources than us have struggled with this and failed. Plus we just can’t bring ourselves to charge shipping costs in excess of the price of the product itself, and for that philosophy we can only apologize in advance.
STRETCH GOALS
There aren’t any! We’re not fooling around here. The entirety of funds raised for this project are being devoted to creating one of the best new gaming zines around. They say “Content is King”, and that axiom is our guiding principle at SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN.
ADD-ONS
Did you miss out on any of our prior projects? We got you. To add-on any of the following items, just click the handy ADD ON button in the pledge manager after pledging and you're all set!
SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.1 ($12 backer-only price)
With metric tons of mighty new content for your post-apocalyptic or genre-mash fantasy game, SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN No.1 has it all. You’ll be amazed at The Ecology of the Crater Mutant by Levi Combs (Planet X Games), astounded at the robotic mounts of S.A.B.L.E. Rangers by Mike and Elizabeth Stewart (Victorious RPG), and astonished at the malevolent diseases in Mutant Maladies by Skeeter Green (SGP Games). All that and a mini-adventure that’s not-so-mini in Jim Wampler’s The Gene Looms of Janeck-Vacca.
SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 also includes ongoing features that will continue in every issue, with new mutations, new monsters, new artifacts, Retro Reviews of inspirational source media and material, and of course Scientific Comics right in the back featuring Jolly Blackburn and Travis Hanson!
Digest 6” x 9” softcover, 84 pages, PRINT+PDF
CHECK THIS ARTIFACT ($13 backer-only price)
Check This Artifact contains 30 brand-new artifacts of the Ancient Makers, plus a full write up of a new godlike AI and its neural programs (spells), all for use in any d20-based post-apocalyptic role playing game or genre-mash fantasy role playing game.
Digest 6” x 9” softcover, 60 pages, PRINT+PDF
FIGHT THIS MUTANT ($17 backer-only price)
Fight This Mutant contains over 30 brand-new mutant monsters and races, a whole new Ancient Alliance your player characters can join or fight, a brand-new character class — the Technomancer, and 15 new neural programs (spells) from 1st through 5th levels. Usable in any d20-based post-apocalyptic or genre-mash fantasy role playing game.

“What is that?” Annie asked, frantic.
 Harry kept this gaze on the field. There was a figure moving out there in the darkness. It seemed to waver as it moved. “Is that Alan?” he asked quietly.
 A rustling in the bushes released another scream from Annie. She clapped her hands over her mouth as soon as it began, stifling the sound.
“Will you stop that?” Evan snipped.
 Harry stood very still. He could almost sense something around them, just out of his range of vision. A darkness streaked across the corner of his eye. He glanced, but it was gone. It happened again; and again, he turned. There was nothing there.
Scritch. Scritch. Scritch.
In the 1980s, strange things happened everywhere...

Created by Wet Ink Games in partnership with Bloat Games, Dark Places & Demogorgons 5e is a totally new way to experience the game of 80s teen horror originally designed by Eric Bloat and Josh Palmer.
In this standalone game, you play as teenagers from "Anytown, USA" where strange occurrences have popped up all around. The adults seem lost about what to do; the police are as clueless as ever and aren’t helping. It’s up to you and your friends to figure out what’s going on and stop it from happening again!
Take on the role of a new student at the local Junior High School and build your character from the ground up using a unique character creation process where you step through student orientation with the school guidance counselor. What is your background? Are you the new kid in town? What did you do this past summer? Are you planning to take part in any extracurricular activities? The choice is yours.

DELUXE BOXED SET COMPONENTS
Art to be revealed throughout the campaign!

Based on the hugely popular 5th Edition of the world's most popular RPG, Dark Places & Demogorgons adds some new concepts to the familiar ruleset to make a uniquely fun and entertaining game experience. Choose extra-curricular activities to give your characters their bonus proficiencies. Play through the big events of the school year from The Big Game to Dance Night. Prepare for monsters, but remember human threats like The Star Children and Special Agent Spanner can be just as much of a problem.
Characters
Dark Places & Demogorgons allows both experienced players and newcomers to be able to create a character in a few short minutes.  Players familiar with 5e will be able to dive right in with the easy to follow character creation system, and new players will find a helpful walkthrough which helps them learn the mechanics wile also learning more about this new student they're creating and how they will interact with the setting. 
Thought there are some classes which may seem familiar, Dark Places & Demogorgons  puts players in control of building the kind of group they want. Do you want to emulate "The Nerd, The Princess, The Jock, The Basket Case, and The Criminal?" Do you want to search for pirate gold while dodging criminals a booby traps? Maybe you just want to play games with your friends, but the new kid in town is really acting weird and messing up your plans. The stories are neverending...

The Fighter (Wrestler)

Balancing the responsibilities of making it to practice, the pressures of the big game, and keeping up a social life, while still making time for school and family functions are just a few of the challenges characters may encounter in Dark Places & Demogorgons.
The Magician

Others must prioritize keeping up with their studies, not just reading, writing, and arithmetic, but also those of a more mystical nature they are just discovering. The pressures may be different, but their powers come from somewhere - if they can use magic, others can too.
There are often other odd occurances that can happen to characters as they grow older, some are completely normal and expected, and then there are...well...others that you won't find out about in your science text book...
The Teen Wolf

Strange Things are Afoot...
Every town has it's stories, and everyone knows them. Some kids say that they're just things the grown-ups tell us to keep us out of trouble and away from places we shouldn't be. Other kids know better. 
Rumors spread pretty quickly about weird things that happen in small towns. Whispers around the school, spooky stories around the campfire, or scary events on the outskirts of town your big brother or sister tells you happened to them and their friends. 
The Haunted Car
 Dark Places & Demogorgons takes these urban legends and puts them at the forefront of your own stories. As you go about your lives, you realize that there may be more to these tales than others let on. As you play your sessions, you begin to uncover the mysteries about your town, and the truth about those trying to keep their secrets.
The Goatman!

And more to come...



Shipping Information
We plan to release the digital version of Dark Places & Demogorgons in March 2021. We plan to release the physical version to our backers in April 2021, with the game being made available to stores soon after. We will use DriveThruRPG for all of our digital fulfillment.

For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING.
We will be using BackerKit, a pledge manager, to collect information from backers.

NOTE: The final cost of shipping may differ from our estimations, and there will be slight variation from country to country. We will also be charging applicable taxes based on your location. For EU backers, this will mean the 20% VAT tax.

If you live in AU, CAN, EU, or USA you will not pay any fees beyond shipping and applicable taxes. Any shipments to countries outside of those regions may be subject to standard customs charges.

Risks and challenges
Q: Can Wet Ink Games handle this project?
A: This is our seventh Kickstarter, after five previous successful projects. With each one we have learned more about the industry and best practices. We are entering this project with the project almost completely designed, and developed, with only our final quantities left to nail down before sending to production. With the things we learned from previous projects, we are confident we can handle this project. Bloat Games brings a wealth of knowledge to this partnership as well, and we know we'll be able to make this project as good as it can possibly be.

Q: How much of the books are already finished?
A: The game is pretty much complete and ready to send to production. The text potentially added by stretch goals is not written yet, but the writers will be able to complete their portions quickly. Many of these adventure stretch goals are to be digital goals, potentially collected into another volume later, and will have no impact on the delivery of the main product.

Q: Have you produced all these items before?
A: Between Wet Ink Games, Bloat Games, and our production partners, all of these components have been made before and are well within our capabilities to produce using industry best practices.

Q: What if shipping costs increase?
A: Shipping costs are well beyond our control. We’ve made our best projections and those shipping fees will be collected through Backer Kit. Once that money is in hand, we’ll send the items, even it we end up eating a cost increase. Though we can make no promises about international shipping, we will always try our best to do right by our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This book is 100% insane! We give you post-apocalyptic fantasy wastelands, psionics, AND madness-inducing monstrosities! You're going to LOVE it!
The Scourge of the Scorn Lords is unapologetically dangerous! Think of it as a mashup of Mad Max, Fist of the North Star, Dark Sun, and the Beastmaster, with a healthy dose of The Land That Time Forgot for good measure. 
Use The Scourge of the Scorn Lords as a stand-alone book or as part of the Meatlandia Trilogy! 
This is the third and final installment of the Meatlandia Trilogy and the immediate follow-up to our Ennie-nominated book, Worm Witch: the Life and Death of Belinda Blood. 
For the discerning adventurer and those of you who enjoyed (and survived) the other books, you're going to love this one—but if you're new to Knight Owl Publishing's work, don't worry: you don't need the previous books in the series to tackle the ultimate adventure of the Scorn Lands!  
In other words, The Scourge of the Scorn Lords is a setting and adventure book that can stand alone but also interlocks perfectly with everything in the other installments of the Meatlandia Trilogy. How's that for AWESOME?
The campaign has been going really well so far, with four stretch goals unlocked already! So far, we are foil stamping the cover, printing awesome tables on the end-papers, including a killer fold-up map with every book, and getting professional editing from one of the best in the industry...with more to come! All stretch goals will be included with every physical backer level and will also be included in pdf format with every digital backer level.
 $12,000 — We foil stamp the title on the standard edition's cover, because the only thing better than a dope cover is an even doper cover. 
 $15,000 — Printed End-Papers for both editions with new Vehicle Mayhem Tables, Giant Insect Generators and Rumor Tables for each city! 
 $17,000 — We will include a spectacular 15″ x 12″ fold-up map of the Scorn Lands with every physical copy of the book!
 $20,000 — We get help with making our words more prettier from Vi Huntsman of the Moon Rats, whose previous works include Best Left Buried and Mork Borg!
 $22,000 — NEWLY ADDED!!! We will create and print Scoundrels of the Scorn Lands: a fully illustrated zine stuffed with pre-generated NPCs, hirelings, villains, and adversaries, plus wasteland vehicles and vehicle record sheets. We will include digital copies with every backer level and print copies with every physical backer level.
 $25,000 — A micro-zine Scorn Lords solo RPG we include with every order. Those ordering physical copies of the zine get pdf and print copies, those getting digital downloads will receive a pdf. Load up your wagon with goods, set off into the Scorn Lands, and hope not to die.
 $30,000 — We include a Kickstarter Exclusive print zine of Into the Space Worm dungeon with every physical copy of the book! Designed for convention play, can be played traditionally or two Referees can run two games at the same time and then combine them at the climax.
Interior pages 
Over 100 pages of mind-bending, wasteland-surviving, post-apocalyptic old school awesomeness printed on super high quality 80# paper! And now, thanks to our spectacular backers, we have hired Vi Huntsman, whose previous works include Best Left Buried and Mork Borg, to meticulously edit the entire book!
Cover 
A super awesome glossy  6" x 9" hard-cover with our best cover art yet!  And now, thanks to our spectacular backers, every physical standard edition copy of Scourge of the Scorn Lords will feature exquisite gold foil stamped lettering on the title text!
Art
TONS of insanely cool hand drawn art by Wind Lothamer 
 Tables everywhere! 
Literally everywhere—we have so many tables in this book! We have d8 tables, d12 tables, d20 tables, two 6d10 tables, even a d66 table! Why? Because randomness rules! And now, thanks to our benevolent backers, even the end-papers of Scourge of the Scorn Lords will be printed with tables galore!
Tables are the best :)
No lie: we play just about everything, from Chainmail to 5e, but our favorite flavor is the B/X style OSR. So you're going to find that just about everything we have in here fits that mold. That means all three of our books are completely compatible with Old-School Essentials—the gold standard in Old School RPG awesomeness!
 The Scorn Lands 
A mad wasteland full of harsh monsters, bands of cannibalistic marauders, and the savage Scorn Lords. This massive setting includes maps, encounter tables, rules for dehydration and heat stroke, and more!
 The Scorn Lords 
An ancient brood of sorcerer-demigods that rule the Scorn Lands with an iron fist. Some will try to kill you, but it's the ones who want to hire you that you need to truly wary about. Scourge of the Scorn Lords was written for faction play, allowing to you to join them and lead their forces, battle them with plucky rebels, or in true Kurosawan fashion, play them off one another. 
 Psionics 
A full OSE-compatible ruleset for running psionics, with 23 psionic powers, rules for generating wild talents, and a new psionic character class! 
 New Classes 
The mind-bending Mentalist, the beast-besting Monster Honcho, the ghostly Fade, and the insectoid Myrmeke bring a taste of your favorite versions of the apocalypse to the Scorn Lands. Keep track of your Scorn Lands characters with your very own Scourge of the Scorn Lords Character Reference Sheet! Get the sheets here. 
Play new classes or your old favorites!
 Vehicles and Animals 
Rules for creating desert-driving contraptions, outfitting them for war, and pulling them with horses, camels, elephants, giant insects, and dinosaurs!  And now, thanks to our amazing backers, every single copy of Scourge of the Scorn Lords will feature printed end-papers, which will include quick tables for rolling up unique Scorn Lands wasteland vehicles and giant insects!  
Crazy vehicles pulled by crazy animals!
 A ton of monsters 
Seriously—we went crazy with the bestiary!!! We have everything from Barren Elves to Sonic Geckos and from Chitin Golems to Vultards. 
Beware the Jathrax!
 Tables Galore 
Encounter Tables, Rumor Tables, Village Tables, Background Tables, and more—everything you need to run a massive sandbox in our mighty wasteland. You can run this game with almost no prep time whatsoever. And now, thanks to our brilliant backers,  every copy of Scourge of the Scorn Lords will include printed end-papers packed full of new Wasteland Vehicle Generation Tables, Vehicle Mayhem Tables, and Giant Insect Tables!
Kaldane Hunters are one of dozens of encounters in the Scorn Lands.
 An Awesomely Detailed Map of the Scorn Lands. 
Including tables and stats for all the regions and cities. And now, thanks to our incredible backers, every single copy of Scourge of the Scorn Lords will include a beautiful 15″ x 12″ fold-up version of the map printed on 100# Matte paper!
The Scorn Lands in all their glory!
Stretch Goal Unlocked!
 New Weapons, New Armor, and New Equipment 
Gladiator weapons, non-lethal weapons, rules for building awesome suits of piecemeal armor, equipment to help survive the wastes, and insane new stuff for outfitting your wasteland vehicles. 
All new treasures await!
And MORE!
This book has many more things that you've neither seen nor even thought of before! In short, it has enough maps and art to fill an Instagram feed and enough adventure to last for months. It’s also perfectly happy to sit on your shelf, relegated to posing for sexy shelfies. Enjoy it however it most suits you!
Drawing like crazy!
“A brutal trek through the Scorn Lands chased by Vampiric Allosauruses and psionic war machines on wingboards, as seven warlords vie for power; a fantastic end to the Meatlandia trilogy but a beginning to the terror of the Scorn Lords.” 
— Sean Richer, Terror of the Stratosfiend 

"My character went to the Scorn Lands and all she got me was this... can I even call it a T-shirt? It's made out this substance that... wait, *this* was what she found in that canopic jar in the giant insect city, under the wastelands somewhere near the village built on top of a lake with the creepy overlord that sent her to investigate the giant stone worm corpse that had fallen from the sky, where she died a horrible death at the hands of otherworldly horrors? Okay, hold my beer..."
— Gord Sellar, Fermentvm Nigrvm Dei Sepvlti
Standard and Special Editions
We like you so much that we are making an awesome Special Edition version of the book! That's right—just for Kickstarter backers, you will have the option to purchase either the standard version or the Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE Special Collector's Edition (or both)! The Special Edition is printed on solid black leatherette with silver spot foil lettering and graphic—check it out!
THAT IS SO METAL!
You can now get all three books in the Meatlandia Trilogy at the same time—don't miss out!
The Complete Meatlandia Trilogy!
Not only are we reprinting The Chaos Gods Come to Meatlandia and Worm Witch: The Life and Death of Belinda Blood, but we're also making a complete COLLECTOR'S EDITION SET on black leatherette with new spot-foil covers!
These are printed by the exact same company that printed the Special Collector's Edition Books from The Old School Essentials Kickstarters!
YES!!! GIVE ME!!!!
We learned a lot from our last Kickstarter—so this time we are going to be fulfilling all digital orders through DriveThru RPG. 
Print & PDF Options
We offer a ton of configurations for your backing pleasure—plus we have signed on for the debut of the Kickstarter Add On Store, which means that you will also be able to add more options after the Kickstarter ends!
 NOW: AN AWESOME BONUS GIFT JUST FOR YOU!!
We bring you a free Scourge of the Scorn Lords Character Reference Sheet! And because you are so awesome, we give you FOUR DIFFERENT VERSIONS: Hand Drawn small half-fold sheet, Hand Drawn full-size sheet, Fancy Vector Art small half-fold sheet, and Fancy Vector Art full-size sheet. Enjoy! Get the sheets here. 
 And now, thanks to our bodacious backers, we will also include a Vehicle Reference Sheet for all of your awesome wasteland vehicles in the Scoundrels of the Scorn Lands supplemental zine!
What are you waiting for?

updates.update_content:
Hey all--
I just received an update informing me that our books have completed the journey across the Atlantic and come into port in New York. They are getting offloaded, passing through customs, and finding their way onto a train that will bring them out to Portland in the coming days. Right now the estimated delivery date is June 5, at which time we will begin boxing the books up and shipping them out to you!

I don't like to get too excited about things, but these pics that the printer sent me of our finished books look AWESOME!
The books are printed and shipping out from Lithuania today. In 40 days and 40 nights they should show up at Knight Owls HQ and we'll be ready to bundle in maps, zines, and micro-zines and them ship them on to you. It won't be long now!

Hey all--
Ahimsa sent out pdf download links to all of the digital backers yesterday. This is our first time using DTRPG for fulfillment and it seemed to go really smoothly, but please let us know if we messed anything up or if you didn't get your links. DTRPG says you should also check your spam folders--because the emails might be going there.
I ran into a tiny little snag in figuring out how to get the money from my bank account in the US to the printers in Lithuania, but it's resolved now and! They should be shipping the books to us in mid-April and, after a looong voyage across the sea, we should have them right around the end of May.

Hey everybody, here's a brief update from the Scorn Lands:
We now have gotten all of our printed stretch goals in from the printers. We are currently furiously folding maps and micro-zines :)
In addition, the secret digital bonus of the Scorn Lords Solo Rules by Alex T. and Ahimsa is done! 
All of the digital files have been bookmarked and uploaded to DriveThru RPG. We are currently conducting a few quality tests to make sure our download links are good, but you should be able to .

There's a lot going on at Knight Owl HQ these days. Here's a brief run-down:
 The fold-out maps have been printed and they look great!
Scoundrels of the Scorn Lands is at the printers right now.
 I just uploaded all of the files for the Scourge of the Scorn Lords and the other three books to the printers. They include 4 book inlays, 8 different cover files, and 2 endpapers!
I completed a proof of concept for the layout of the micro-zine solo game. It's going to be one of those neat fold-up zines with the game rules on one side and the map and tables on the other. (The game has already been written--just needs to look pretty.)

Hey there--update time.
I got the final line edits back from Vi last week and made all of the final formatting edits and changes to the book, which means that it is so very close to ready to go! Just have to get our ISBNs in place and do a final printed proof-pass, then it's off to the printer--some time before Valentine's Day--and a loong wait until we get the final volumes. 
On that same note, I have finished designing and laying out all 7 book covers! (Standard and Special Editions of Scourge of the Scorn Lords, Worm Witch: the Life and Death of Belinda Blood, and Chaos Gods Come to Meatlandia, as well as an all new print run of The Black Blade of the Demon King through Standartu, which is going to be awesome!)

Happy New Year, all. It's been a little while, so I thought I would put out a quick update on the status of The Scourge of the Scorn Lords:
I finished laying out the entire book! No joke--I did this one in record time. Definitely my most challenging layout job yet, but it's finished and it looks amazing! I am super proud of what I have been able to do with the book. It's 100 pages exactly and jam-packed with awesomeness--you're going to love it! (We still need to make a couple of final editing passes before we send it to the printer for proofing, but right now we are way ahead of schedule :D)
